text: Good service, great bottomless mimosas and bellini's! Came for brunch on Saturday and it was soo good we came back on Sunday. Whenever I come to Vegas I will be sure to come here!!
Had great food and wine here. Had salad, bruschetta and a flatbread. Delicious! A bit pricey but I would definitely come here again.

Perfect dinner thanks to Momo and delicious food.  Delicious lasagna, rigatoni and my husband can't stop raving about the cioppino  We liked it so much we ate here two nights in a row!! Until next time Momo, thank you.
Expensive, small portions, mediocre food. Go somewhere else!

The food and service was excellent !
I ordered pasta with shrimps and other delicious things from the ocean. Very good! I recommend anyone to try this restaurant out.

It is good food for your money, even for Vegas.

Absolutely outstanding. My wife and I had our wedding dinner there and we helped by exceptional restaurant managers to choose our menu as well as we were exceptionally well cared for during the dinner by Antonio, the waiter assigned to us. The food was by all accounts of those present, exceptional. It really was. I loved every minuted of our time there and I look forward to visiting again next time we are in town.
We wanted to order gluten-free pasta and we were told to wait 40 minutes that should change the water in the pots. Anyone who wants to order pasta desirable to call to book in advance,
Found a piece of glass in my cup of water. Manager acting rude to my family on Mother's Day. This place needs to check how they serve and change this manager.

This place is awesome! Seriously the food is really really good. I don't know what everyone is thinking. I went for dinner one night and i was very impressed. The service was great, drinks very good and food excellent. I would recommend this place in a minute! Try it if you find yourself in vegas.

Not much more to add here, the food was average to above average, I had the lasagna, which was really good, but the portion size wasn't impressive, and you have to order a la carte, for most entrees do not include a salad or side.  Bread came prior to our meal, but wasn't great by any means.  The service was slightly below average, as the server we had was slow to refill drinks, and didn't seem to pay much attention to us throughout the meal, which was irritating because it was not exceptionally busy. A house salad my date got was $8 by the way, and not much to show for it.  Overall, overpriced, and the service needs some work, the food was on point though.

This place was very meh. The food was very mediocre and pricey for what we received . I ordered the chicken parm and my friend ordered alfredo. The Alfredo was thick and goofy. My chicken parm was greasy, unseasoned, and had terrible sauce and cheese. Our waiter was good and friendly though. $15 unlimted mimosas were also a nice plus.the foccacia bread was good. If I'm in vegas again, I will not be coming back.

The food is really delicious. Everytime I come to Vegas, I like to come here. The service is very good and the servers are very nice. I brought my sorority sisters to celebrate a bachelorette and the food was served quickly.

I never expect much when it comes to food in Vegas, and I expect even less in desert passage.

However when my friend and I decided we needed something that wasn't a burger and wasn't a buffet we decided to go here.

We were both amazed at the service and quality of food.
Our waiter was so polite and very pleasant 
and the food...well let's just say we're already planning a trip back based on Lombardi's!

My wife and I hosted our reception here following our wedding and had a wonderful experience.  Staying in Planet Hollywood it was an extremely convenient location for us.  We worked with Lombardi's to set up a prix fixe meal for 31 people with an appetizer, three entree selections, and a dessert.  The staff was very attentive filling drinks and keeping the bread plates coming for our guests.  My wife and I loved the food and heard many compliments from our guests as well.  Highly recommended!

We planned on having dinner with the fam before seeing V.  After walking through the Miracle Mile shops (and enjoying that cool fake sky), we ended up at Lombardi's, right across from the V Theatre.  The patio seating was pretty full, so we asked for a table inside, the hostess took a peak and told us they didn't have anything available and offered us the first patio table (right next to the hostess desk).  They quickly opened up the table and set us up with 5 seats.

Everyone was hungry and we tore into the bread and dipping oil (with parmesan cheese... ooh!) immediately.  For starters, we had the fried calamari and the Caesar salad, both were good.  I had the lobster ravioli.  The ravioli was really good, but the filling wasn't the best (i.e., didn't really taste like lobster at all).  The hubby had the linguine frutti di mare, which was very tasty.  The linguini was excellent and the sauce was yummy.  The kiddies ordered angel hair pasta (I didn't try it) and tagliatelle with chicken, truffle oil and wild mushrooms (yummy!).  Unfortunately, we were all too full for dessert, so I missed my favorite part of the meal...

Service was good and the food was pretty reasonably priced, except for my lobster ravioli.  $20+ for something that didn't even taste like lobster!  One more thing, after dinner, us girls had to use the facilities, and as I walked through the restaurant, there was not a soul sitting inside with the exception of the private party area in the back of the restaurant.  In fact, there was a table set up for 5 right inside the front door!  Tsk-tsk...

Pleasantly surprised.  We've been here a few times now and each time we asked "what are your top three dishes / favorites / sellers" and each time we were extremely happy with the results.
Great food and service.  Definitely coming back!

This is the first review I have written for anything anywhere.  Unfortunately, it is for a restaurant and I cannot even comment on the food.

My husband works in commercial real estate development, and needed to be in Las Vegas for the week.  We live on the East Coast, but I decided to tag along and work remotely.  My last day here, I thought it would be nice to sit down somewhere and have lunch, even if I had to dine solo. Not being able to decide on a place to eat, I called my husband.  

I was on the phone when I walked up to the host at Lombardi's, but asked my husband to hold one second.  I asked the host if I could be seated for one.  He said there was a 15-20 minute wait for the outside tables, and offered me the bar.  Dining alone, I actually didn't want to sit outside and asked for a table inside.  All the tables inside were empty except for two.  He looked me in the eye and said he could only seat me at the bar because all the tables were taken.  I said, "but I can see the tables and all but two of them are empty."  He reiterated that there were people waiting for them and they weren't available.  

I walked away dumbfounded, noting that the only other person dining solo in the restaurant was seated at the bar.  I ended up eating across the way from Lombardi's at La Salsa Cantina but to exit the mall I had to walk by Lombardi's again.  I noticed that, at this point, not a single table inside was taken.  I don't mind dining at the bar in a restaurant if a restaurant is packed, but I feel like I should have the right to sit at a table if there are tables available even if I am dining solo.  

I debated whether or not to go back and ask for the manager's name.  Eventually, I did.  I walked up to the host again and asked if he was the manager and he said, yes, so I asked him if I could have his supervisor's name and contact information, along with his name.  He balked and asked me why.  I recounted our exchange of less than an hour before and he proceeded to not only disparage me, but flat-out lie about what had transpired.  After ten minutes of this, I eventually got the host's name and the name and contact information for the Director of Operations.

Once I got back to my room, I immediately called the Director of Operations located in Dallas.  He was very apologetic and extremely understanding.  He repeatedly asked if my husband and/or I would go back to Lombardi's as their guest.  While I very much appreciated his offer, his professionalism, and his compassion, I will never again set foot in this restaurant - solo, with my husband, or with anyone else.

We had dinner here. The food was mediocre at best. For an appetizer we had chef's focaccia. It was a pizza crust. Bland. The dipping sauce had vinegar mixed in like a salad dressing. It was not a good match. The rigatoni entrée was flavorful but upset my stomach. The waiter never asked how our meal was after we were served. I would not eat here again and I would not recommend it.

This is the first Yelp review I have ever written. I just returned from dinner at Lombardi's with my family and I can rate the food a solid "C". Lobster ravioli was good, seafood fettucine was good. fettucine bolognese was mediocre at best, and lasagna was straight from the microwave with the sauce congealed into skin on the top. The salads were just OK.

 But the thing that led me to write this review was the 17% service charge added to our bill. When questioned, our waiter showed me the last line of the menu...in the smallest print. imaginable...after the name, address and phone number of the restaurant was a statement that a 17% service charge would be added to parties of 5 or more. Even after it was pointed out to me, I had trouble finding it on the menu. 

To be fair, the waiter offered to remove the charge when I told him that I preferred to give a tip, rather than have one taken from me. So, I left the service charge on, which was less than I would have tipped the waiter left to my own devices.

Avoid this restaurant at  all costs....not a worthwhile dining experience.

Received free vouchers to this place as part of a VIP package from a close by timeshare sales pitch. The place is great in terms of service, cleanliness and location. The food however, not so good. We received a special menu since we had the free vouchers. This may have been why the food wasn't good - who knows. Alfredo was on par with something from the frozen isle at your local grocer. Sadly I won't be getting that dinner back but perhaps I can spare some of you the wasted time.

Pass on this place.  We wound up here because we were just out of the show and we were starving.  The food is mediocre at best.  We all ordered, 6 in all.  The food came at a lightening speed.  That seemed too amazing.  However, it tasted like nothing was cooked to order.   it seemed like they just have all the elements of every dish sitting in a warming pan and assemble it when ordered.  After the meal,  I canvassed our group regarding their opinions of the place.  Three gave it three out of five stars. The other three, including me, gave it two stars. Never again

Randomly ate here when I was last in Vegas. I ordered the gnocchi alla caprese and my boyfriend got the Maine lobster ravioli. Both were very tasty! The lobster tasted fresh, and I could tell the pasta was made in-house (at least it tasted like it was)! 

Overall the experience was very nice and relaxing! We finished off with the balsamic ice cream with biscotti and (I think sautéed?) strawberries. It was super delicious. Never tasted anything like it before! 

I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in Vegas!

A place after my own heart: an entire section of the menu is devoted to risotto.  I stopped by here for a quick bite to eat for dinner before the performance I was attending.  I had the risotto al parmigiano as I was assured by the waitress that it was the cheesiest thing ever, and I was not disappointed.  It was cooked well (unlike other expensive restaurants that I had visited in my trip), although a little saltier than I would have liked, it was indeed cheesy and delicious.  I also had a side of their meatballs, which were delicious.  Recommended, especially if you happen to be going to the V Theater as they can usually give you a "dinner and a show" discount.
Lombardis is a great place on the strip, they make fresh pasta and so far the best pizza in town, that's from my Italian friends!!

Best pasta I've had in a long time.  Nice casual ambiance, Apolo is a very friendly waiter with excellent and attentive service.  Food came amazingly fast.  I'd recommend this as a great choice in the Miracle Mile mall.

I went for lunch with two adult friends and two children. There were a few good things and a few bad things about the restaurant. I'll start with the bad so I can end with the good. I spent eight dollars for a house salad that was drenched in dressing. I truly suffered through the salad because it was soggy and tasted horrible because of all of the dressing. I then spent $25 on the lobster ravioli. It tasted delicious however the portion was so small that after spending almost $35 on food I left hungry. Not cool. However the atmosphere was nice and our service was excellent. I suggest that you ask about portion size before you order and get your dressing on the side.

Love this place.Fun , friendly and the food I delicious and authentic.We had a Ribeye that was served with mushrooms,roasted potatoes and asparagus.A little trouffle butter to top it off.Awsome.Started off with a thin crust wood fired pizza with prochutto.Amazing.My wife had a seafood risotto,Loved it.The wine was great and not off the charts pricewise.We finnished with ricotta cheesecake ,creme brulee and cappuccino.Oh and some lemonchello.We sat on the patio and watched the fountain show across the way.Exellent experience.Thank you Carlos ,Brad,and Johnny.A++

We came here after searching on Yelp for Italian food for about 20 minutes before our show at the V theater, which is pretty much right around the corner.  We were seated pretty fast without a wait.  I had the lobster ravioli, which was ok, nothing special honestly.

An elderly gentleman came to our table and sung a song along with his violin "Lionel Richie"(note the bunny ears)  for 30 seconds than asked for tips.  I only had $20s on me, so I asked for change.  He dropped the money a bill at a time between two plates of food as if it was invisible.  

A lady also took a picture of us and showed us two frames.  One for 15, and two for 20.  Both of which were in Las Vegas frames.  When I asked for both, I didnt notice that she slipped one of the pictures off the frame, and into the bag.  I had to track her down to get money back since this was not what she clear on her "sale". 

Thanks to the older gentleman, I had to knock a star off of my experience.  Mr. Lombardi, please do not hire people to rain money on my food!!


Cheers

Came here because my best friend's boyfriend said it would be good. Sorry to say I was pretty disappointed. 

I ordered the soup of the day, which was a zucchini saffron soup. or i think it was zucchini... it was definitely some vegetable and saffron because it was bright green. Decent. 
My friend and I shared a Capelli'D Angelo (angel hair pasta tossed with tomatoes and basil). It was just ok. Not super flavorful, but that might have been just the dish anyways. 

The service was horrible. The restaurant was not busy at all. We were seated outside and the waitress barely came by ever. My best friend is a former waitress and even she was appalled by the poor service. 

I guess maybe because it's Vegas and everyone talks about how awesome the food is, but I guess it can be a hit or miss. Perhaps we just tried the wrong dishes from here, but I don't really see myself coming back.

We got free dinner and a show from hotel. They have a separate menu for these 'free' meals. They did offer to give credit toward full price item on regular menu. 

Food was good. The 'spicy' tilapia that I had was not spicy, but I think the blackening is probably enough that some people may find it spicy. 

We would not have gone there on our own. The free meal was good to get us to look at menu and choose it. Drinks tip and tax are not included.

We came here for dinner as part of a package deal with a show at the V theater, so the location and discounted price were convenient for us. 

The atmosphere was nice with the painted sky ceiling and castle themed decor making it feel like outdoor seating, and the fountain located directly across the way was additional entertainment with its musical light show. 

The service was wonderful. We were treated in a courteous, respectful, and professional manner. We were seated immediately, and the menu clearly showed the dinner options our promotion covered. The waiter made such good recommendations we decided to eat off the menu instead of getting the free entrees. The $15 rib eye was cooked to perfection, definitely not the quality we were expecting for the price. Everything we tried was just delicious. 

The shops are Miracle Mile have photographers who rove around the restaurants getting shots of the diners for souvenirs, and the photographer we got was just wonderful. She engaged so well even our infant was smiling for the photo- we couldn't help but buy one. 

Both the service and the quality of the food exceeded our expectations considering the low prices. We were happy to leave a 25% tip and would definitely return the next time we're in Las Vegas.

This restaurant is a classic Italian gem.  I've eaten here twice, and you get exactly what you should expect.  Is it Mario Batali's B&B Ristorante?  Not exactly, but it's also 1/3 the price and located in a mall.  Come expecting well executed high quality american style italian food in a comfortable setting with friendly service.  It's a convenient location and it is in my opinion the best restaurant in the vicinity.  You can go spend $120 per person across the strip, or you can spend $30 per person here and be just about as happy.  Two thumbs up for Lombardi's!

In November we reserved Lombardi's for our 3/4/16 wedding reception. In the process the number of guest nearly doubled and we were scared that we'd lose our reservation. That was not the case. Not only was the manager, Bradley, able to accommodate our increasing party, but he created a menu that was catered specifically to our needs and budget. We cannot thank him and his staff enough for the amazingly great job they did hosting our reception. The   seafood risotto and the piccata were delicious. We will definitely be visiting Lombardi's next time we are in Las Vegas. Thanks again for hosting a great wedding reception.

OMG! This place was a desert oasis. Found it during breakfast. Best and freshest eggs in town. Met the owner Bradley. Turned us onto theatre ticks and came back for the gluten free pizza and pasta. Heaven and can I get an Amen!! Inside the mag mile planet Hollywood. Right across from V theatre. To die for!!  Thanks

I really liked this place. It is inside Planet Hollywood. We did not sit inside the restaurant. It was great for people watching. I ordered the salmon with spinach. It was fantastic! The salmon was cooked to perfectly. The waitress was super sweet. It was very affordable for a good dinner in Vegas.

Unfortunately, not good. The focaccia was dry and not traditional in any way. My pasta was undercooked and the marinara tasted like a plan can of tomato sauce. My friend for the tilapia and mashed potatoes and the potatoes were like sand. The service was good but the food was not worth anything.

Our reservations at Lombardi's was on 10/28/2017 at 6:30pm.  

I really just wasn't impressed by Lombardi's. The food was mediocre, but ok. The services staff was the main issue. Our waitress (thin girl with blonde hair)  was nice-ish... but WAY to pushy. She got extra pushy when not everyone at our table ordered drinks. We get that its Vegas, but someone should not have to justify themselves more then once for not wanting a drink. Then she just kept pushing additional items after our order was placed. I get that its a service industry and she gets a higher tip with a higher bill, but there is also the time to stop and she just didn't see that.

Yum!! I ordered one of the specials of the night which was a filet with a peppercorn sauce. It was awesome. Very tender and cooked to perfection. We also had the bruschetta and it was fabulous. It was just as good as the bruschetta I had in Florence Italy. I will definitely be back.

So, our group was hungover, hungry, and not in the mood for attitude and what did we get? ATTITUDE.  Quite possibly the rudest server I've ever come across.

We were heading to Blondie's cause we heard great things and they had tv's so we could watch the NFL playoffs but after we heard it was an hour wait, we knew we needed to sit down someplace else and start drinking water.

Our waitress was very disparaging and not accommodating at all.  Members of our party politely asked if they could substitute one pasta for another and she made a big fuss about it.  We noticed that she was very rude to the females in our party but was quite nice to the guys in our party.  She only had one other table that we saw her taking care of yet her service was exceptionally slow.  I cannot fathom a restaurant having a wait staff that bad.  I've seen really bad before but this was an extreme new low.

The food was mediocre, nothing to rave about.  I took pictures of just about everything I ate on my trip but I just felt this place had nothing to remember.

Would I come back? That's a negative!
Would I recommend this place? Uhh, No!

Oh and by the way if you have a party of 5 or more 17% will be tacked on your bill as a service charge.. WHAT SERVICE? Horrible.

We dined here in a Wednesday evening so no reservations were needed, we were seated immediately in the patio and greeted with our friendly server. We decided to share a caprese appetizer which was delicious with thick slices of fresh mozzarella with red and yellow grape tomatoes. Entrees ordered were spaghetti and meatballs, cioppino and I ordered chicken parmigiana which came with spaghetti. Everyone enjoyed the food along with a complimentary bread served like a thin crust pizza brushed with garlic and olive oil. For dessert we shared a tiramisu, creme burlee and a double chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream - all very delicious! An enjoyable meal from beginning to end.

Bruschetta wasn't bad. The bread was a bit thick. 

Service was whatever, not memorable. 

Got this cream pasta thing... but I don't remember the name ... so it wasn't good enough to be remembered. 

I will never come back. We didn't even get bread! (which I read on some of the earlier reviews)

Unfortunately, I was disappointed by this place.  I've walked by on several occasions and always wanted to try it out.  Last week we went for din on Sunday.  The decor is nice, if you sit "outside" where you can people watch on but inside is cozy as well.

Wine list is nothing to rave about, just the regular names you see in most grocery stores.  We ordered the calamari app. which was below par.  It had no flavor, which I guess is better than tasting bad, it was strange, it just didn't taste like anything at all. The only flavor was the marinara sauce they served with it which just tasted canned.  Our table had a white pepperoni pizza, the roasted chic pasta and the seafood pasta.  The pizza came burned which was a little strange to us since the restaurant wasn't very busy so you think they could have kept an eye on the one pizza in the oven.  My chic pasta was just ok, kinda reminded me of something I'd eaten at Olive Garden a decade or more ago.  My friend's seafood pasta had decent flavor but almost NO seafood ! I think she counted two measly shrimp, three baby scallops and two mussels.  I think we expected more for a $20 pasta dish.

Service was decent but overall we were not impressed for the food.  Granted, it is not as expensive as most of the restaurants on the strip, but I wouldn't go back. Had much better Italian food at the restaurant in Paris - which reminds me.... I owe them a worthy review....

this place gets an A+ for atomosphere and service, and D+ for overall food taste/quality.  We ordered a 20.00 dollar traditional italian pizza based off of recommendations from the waiter and it turned out being worse than a 4.00 dollar frozen pizza from Wal-Mart. A truly pathetic attempt at Italian pizza...  
We also ordered a stake that was good...but nothing spectacular. The potatos that came with the plate were the kind of potatos that seemed like sat under a heat lamp since the morning they were cooked. We also ordered the brushetta that was pretty good. 
The standard table bread was delicious, but thats just bread...its kind of hard to mess that up. 
Overall, if you are in Vegas for some yummy Italian cuisine, try somewhere else.
Great dinner tonight. The pasta was excellent and service from Joel was superior. We will definitely return due to the excellent food and service.

We had been walking for a while and kept vetoing each others restaurant ideas until we ended up walking through the Miracle Mile.  We were seated quickly on the "patio" and the server took our drink orders quickly after being seated.  After draining our iced tea a few times, she left a pitcher for us.  In all the service really was pretty good.  

Now for the important part.  I got one of the specials, a lobster and crab ravioli in a garlic tomato cream sauce topped with a whole shrimp.  I can't tell you how my friends' food tasted because I was afraid they might want to try mine and I wasn't giving any up.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious.  My friends said their food was great as well (a pizza and another pasta dish), but I have to take their word for it.

The service was great.  Even though you are sitting inside they have a great patio to sit on. The food was delicious. They have great gluten free options. The ambiance is comfortable. I will definitely eat here again. They made a mistake on the sauce on one dish and they made up for it with a free desert when they didn't have too. Restaurant is clean and hip.

Recently had a small dinner party here and it was awful! The service was poor, management ignored many of requests, the food was cold, and cheaply made. I will never return here even though I was a loyal guest for years.

Got here with my husband on our honeymoon vacation to have dinner. The restaurant is clean. Our waiter is nice while the host doesn't seem to welcome us at all. When we got here, she was busy talking to other 2 staffs till the other woman told her that we were standing there to wait for being seated. The food was ok, it took too long for the main dishes to come out after finishing our appetizers .

Ordered pizza, pasta and couple appetizers. It was delicious! The drinks are amazing and they pour a good amount of alcohol!!! Our waiter was very cool with a good sense of humor. Totally will be back.

PS: Blackberry Mojito was awesome!

Four stars because or server was funny, witty and attentive. The food was what you'd expect for this price point, good, hot, and nice portion sizes. The place is cute and quaint with "patio" seating in the mall portion. Would love if they did fresh grated (off the block) parmesan cheese instead of the dish of crumbled stuff they used.

My girlfriend and I went to dinner last week and we really enjoyed ourselves. The hostess was very friendly, our server was knowledgable, and overall great. The food came out super-fast and it was delicious.
We will recommend this restaurant to anyone at Planet Hollywood.

We had a voucher for dinner and we're pleased with the whole experience. They got us right in and to a quiet table. They offered a choice of 4 entrees, a house or Caesar salad and focaccia to start. I had the Caesar and love it. I actually could have made that my main course but I had ordered the chicken Marsala. It was very good. Very large portion. My hubby had the rigatoni Bolognese and he ate the entire bowl. It was quite meaty. The drinks were not part of the voucher but the bar did offer a full selection of wine and liquor. 
I would definitely go again next time! The service was very attentive as well.

While here on vacation we scored a "free" meal coupon and selected Lombardi's from the list of available restaurants.  Matt was our server.  The "free" dinner we opted out of and instead,  I had the spaghetti with clams and my hubby had the margerita pizza.  Both were served promptly and were tasty.  Is it the best Italian restaurant in Vegas, no but the food was good, the service was excellent and I would happily recommend both the restaurant and Matt if you are in the Miracle Mile area looking for a "decent" Italian restaurant.

Server: 5 stars. Attentive, genuine.

Food: 3 stars. Basic, not a destination to seek out.

Bleach blonde boy in the cheap shiny button up at the front desk: No stars for you Glenn Coco. Condescending. Wanted to ask for toothpicks after dinner on our rush to the show, blondie was talking to another customer. I waited, then saw that the customer was walking away, so I said "pardon" and he turned to me, rolled his eyes and said "I'm helping this man, when I'm done, I will help you," turned his blonde poof back to the man, who was gone, then turned back to me and said "what can I do for you?" Don't talk to people this way. It's lame, like the food being served there. 

Don't go unless you are craving mediocre mall food. Go to the Palms, delicious and everyone from servers to the people filling your waters are kind.
This place is awesome. Fast service & good food ! I loved our waitress Jodie, super sweet!

Staying at Planet Hollywood, I wanted some proper carbs before Sunday's Rock'n'Roll  1/2 Marathon. I checked Yelp from my room, and came across Lombardi's Romagna Mia. It was extremely close, in the Miracle Mile Shops directly below my hotel room and had better than average reviews. 

I made my way down and grab a table. First thing I see on the Specials menu is a serious carb loading dinner consisting of 1 POUND of noodles along with chicken & some sausage. I asked for whole wheat noodles with ruled out the fettuccine & replaced it with spaghetti. No problem. I really enjoyed it, and I'm glad they put it on the menu for us runners. I topped it off with a Ballast Point IPA to round out my meal. 

The service was solid, and the atmosphere in the Miracle Mile was cool. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for a good, solid Italian meal.

We decided to visit this place because it had great reviews. The place is nice and casual. When we sat down for dinner, I ordered a shrimp scampi linguine which was just good. Nothing special. Jaime ordered a medium pan seared filet which tasted old & not edible, so my boyfriend sent it back. He ordered a meat sauce regatoni. IT LOOKED DELICIOUS. Until we tasted it. Omg! It was like chef boyardi. The pasta was soft like chef boyardi and the sauce was the exact recipe as chef boyardi.  I probably will never visit this place again and will probably stir everyone in a another direction if your craving delicious Italian food. 

The waiter Jose was a nice man. He was patient and quick. So thumbs up Jose!!!

I'm surprised this place is only a 3.5. I would give it a 4.5 but am rounding it up to 5 to give it a little boost. 

We did both get pizzas so probably need to try other things, but I was surprised how big it was and how good it was for being in a Vega$ shopping mall. One could easily be shared by 2 if you paired it with a salad. The quality of the cheese was definitely better than average- this was good stuff! It was a pretty darn decent pizza! Crust was decent as well, and it was HUGE!

This was also a nice looking restaurant. It has an open kitchen you see at many decent and higher end restaurants (which I wouldn't call this higher end). It looked like an impressive kitchen that would be helmed by an Executive Chef. 

This was probably one of my better surprises in Vega$. Definitely a good place for lunch- they have lunch specials @ decent prices for an expensive town. Next time I want to try a pasta. Also, the waiter was very nice and asked if we wanted any other toppings on our pizza. I said mushrooms would be great and there was no extra charge. 

I will be back next time I'm in town!

Free voucher from Hilton resort package. Like Andy said, cheap crap came with voucher and you only had 4 choices of the main entree. We ordered Alfredo and surprisingly there was no meat, no vege,  no nothing in the plate except the noodles. You have to pay $10 and above for other entrees. Btw, they also take picture for you and charge you $20 per photo! Terrible !

I will never go back to this place and neither should you. 

1.The food is mediocre at best. It wouldn't be in business if it weren't for the "dinner and a show" package. I bet they get so many people walking by that they don't even care if they get return customers. And it shows.  

2. The manager (beach blonde frat boy) is one of the rudest people I have ever met. I didn't even have to deal with a manager in our situation. Our party just crossed paths multiple times in the restaurant and on all occasions he was a straight up prick. 

3. Happy hour only occurs at the bar is what they told us. And they told us if we wanted the happy hour deal we had to go to the bar. So we placed our order for dinner and the people in our party that drank, walked to the bar to get drinks at a 1/3 of the price. Rather than sit at the table and get up-charged for ordering from the table. 

We were fine with walking our little legs over to the bar for some cheap refreshments, but we had to drink them at the bar. The manager approached us to tell us we could not go back to our seats with happy hour drinks. In my head I am thinking, this is Vegas I can go where ever I want with this drink after I pay for it. But, we kindly sipped at the bar. What we were not fine with was our order being held until we returned to our seats. To reiterate, they did not push the order thru until we finished our drinks at the bar and sat down at the table with the rest of the guests. 


4. At the end of the meal, one of the women in our party had her earring slip out of her ear. The manager walked by and saw it, picked it up and asked if it was anyone's in our party. My aunt asked if she could see it with her hand out, and he pulled back assuming we were going to steal it saying we couldn't put our "hands on it" until he matched the owner. We were kind of annoyed as we couldn't really get a look at it. The girl in our party who's earring it was returned from the restroom and showed the matching one. We knew it was hers, but he wouldn't let us even see it up close to definitely confirm. Super annoying and he was rude and condescending about the whole thing. 

5. Then at the end, we ordered another round of happy hour drinks at the bar. Then, we asked to put them in to-go cups, because Vegas.... what I do not freaking get... is why they held our food until we returned from the bar, if we could order a to-go happy hour drink, and then leave the bar. Why did we have to sit at the bar and finish our drinks during dinner, but could leave after dinner??? This tells me that they were just trying to f*ck with us. Some of the worst display's of hospitality I have ever encountered. 

6. If you do go because you are there with a "dinner and a movie" deal...let's be honest, it is probably like 75% of their business...anyways, if you go because of that, you have 3-4 choices. Otherwise, you can order from the rest of the menu at a $10-15 addition. If you are vegan, tough luck and pay up. There are no vegan options that come with the meal deal. So you would have to pay an extra $10-15 to order something that you can eat. 


two thumbs down.

Great place with really good food and excellent service.  I had the Carbonara while my wife had the Frutti de Mare and my son had the Hash and eggs.  We all loved our choices.  Ambiance is awesome as well.

Disappointing dinner. Charged extra $15 per person for New Year's Eve despite prepaid dinner with show. Caesar salad was tasteless.  Their focaccia was a thin dry pita bread like pizza.  The risotto was underdone by at least 5 minutes with inadequate seasoning.  Would not return even if the dinner was free.

Yay! Brunch in Vegas...yum. 

Buy your mimosa with $1 refills! This allows you to drink and NOT HAVE TO drink your unlimited mimosas...lol 

Great omelet (asparagus with shrimp and hollandaise) it was interesting and good.

We came here for comp pre dinner show. I know some people didn't care for it, but we had no issues at all. It was delicious and one pasta boulinesse gluten free! We had one upgraded to eggplant and I asked Manuel for a favorite. He told me his favorite was Paglia e Fieno and now my favorite! He was very careful to make sure my daughter didn't have any flour including the croutons! Thank you Manuel for great service and a wonderful dining experience!

I had a great experience at this restaurant. We made the reservation last minute.  We're staying at Elara so it's just a few minutes away. 

As we had a party of 20, they arranged tables into a big square to fit all of us, so we could see everyone during our lunch. That was very nice. 

Service was good and the food was pretty good especially the calamari appetizer and the scampi pasta. 

Will definitely go back again.

My husband and I wanted to find a classic, homestyle sort of Italian restaurant near our hotel (Aria) and not pricey. This place was mediocre at best, if you don't mind clam sauce out of a can, Caesar dressing from a bottle, and stale pizza crust as the specialty "garlic bread". The service was good, our server was nice and understood our gripes. He took the cold, stale pizza crust bread off the bill. For $18 my spaghetti and clam sauce was a tiny portion swimming in Progresso canned sauce and a few real clams on top. We shared a Caesar salad of which I took one bite, because it was swimming in some nasty, vinegary bottled sauce - not in the least real caesar. My husband was so hungry he ate it anyway. He liked his fettucini alfredo, not the best but it did the job. We order sautéed spinach on the side that was pretty standard, not bad. All and all, we'll be seeking a different spot for traditional Italian in the future, probably more local and off the strip.

It was located right across from Zombie Burlesque, the show we went to see so it was convenient. The restaurant opens up to the mall & fountain which is really great for people watching! 
The food is great & the service was good. Their focaccia bread fresh out of the oven is a nice touch! See a show at The V Theater or Saxe Theater & you can purchase a discounted dinner which is what we did & it's a great value!

FOOD:

I ordered the gnocchi and my boyfriend got this chicken plate. My gnocchi was pretty good but nothing amazing. The sauce was just regular tasting tomato sauce. I expected they'd do something special to the tomato sauce. My boyfriend's chicken was pretty good as well but the side of potatoes tasted a little burnt. The bread they gave us was hard and tasted like it was sitting around for a while. The only plate that caught my attention was the chocolate soufflé dessert. It was perfect consistency and the chocolate was rich. Even then, I ate a chunk of ice in the ice cream meaning that has been sitting in the freezer too long as well... :-/  
Yes this restaurant's on the strip and it looks good but I wouldn't come back for the food. 

SERVICE:

Service was trash. Our server was nice but he was never around and it wasn't even busy!

INTERIOR:

They sat us outside on the patio where we could people watch. The ambience is really cute and I loved drawing on the paper laid across the table. 

* the ambience of this place is really nice but the food isn't up to par.

Great authentic Italian food and a great, reasonable price. I had the ravioli and my wife had seafood pasta. Both had a glass of wine and only paid around $70. Server was friendly and helpful. Location is ok. Fun atmosphere and show/dinner specials available.
Taylor swift was music was better then the food. portion size was eh. server wad cute but eh. nice location.

Got a gift card to come here so I looked it up online and found out it had a great presentation and marketing to make us want to come here.  The gift card we had was for a special dinner show special.  No biggy.  To upgrade, one get raped on the upgrade price.  Like an extra $12 more for spaghetti.  I asked for a salad but they only use a balsamic dressing.  Can I get one without it.  Waitresses response was no.  What would you like to drink? Menu shows coke.  So can I have a diet coke.  No we only have Pepsi products.  Great.  Can I get a mountain dew.  No.  We only have pepsi, diet p, and Sierra mist.  Ok.  I will have water.  Why she asked? Cause I don't like those choices. Order a steak.  Comes out so cold that it doesn't melt half the the butter they put on it 12 minutes after it was brought out.  It reminded me of the waitress.....COLD.  She asked my spouse how it was...I chimed in.  It's FINE.  We all know what means when a women says that. Sad thing is the table next to us went through the same thing.

It's an Italian restaurant at Miracle Mall in Planet Hollywood. They are busy on the weekends, so reserve a table ahead of time. We reserved a table for 8:30PM and we got their around 8:30 sharp. It took them 10 minutes to get us seated at our table. 

We were served olive oil and balsamic vinegar with focaccia bread. I ordered risotto and my gf ordered gnocchi. The risotto was extra creamy, but the rice very chewy. The risotto was above the quality of many others I had in LV. The gnocchi that my gf had ordered was even better. The pasta and gnocchi is freshly made at this restaurant and you can certainly tell. We finished our meal with Tiramisu, which was also delicious.

I would recommend checking out this location if you are craving Italian for dinner.

Disgusting & NOT FOR BREAKFAST
I  expect lot more from expensive classy restaurant. I came here for breakfast and ordered custom veg omelette. It was made from powdered eggs.. Large fat omelette but without taste. No flavor to it. The potatoes were bland too. Toast is not included as side  in inflated breakfast price. Overall a waste of calories. I had to eat it all as it was so expensive. Will not be returning for another meal here. 
EXCELLENT and FRIENDLY service (Thats what 1 star is for). I'd give them zero otherwise.
service was horrible. Asked for a glass to 3 different ppl before i got a dirty one

My husband and I went for dinner here after the Variety Show. Food was excellent. I had the fettuccine alfredo which was sooo good! Creamy but not heavy. Also the sangria was delicious. Staff was attentive to our needs  and we got refills without even asking. Will be back on our next trip!

If you like Olive Garden, you will love Lombardi's: decent food, but nothing special. The restaurant is essentially glamorized mall cuisine, located adjacent to the V Theatre. The atmosphere is noisey with zero intimacy. Full disclosure, our meal was included with a show. The fettuccini alfredo with mushrooms was edible and filling.

We chose Lombardi's as one of four Miracle Mile choices on a "dinner show" voucher. We decided to eat after the show and were expecting to get the cheap seats treatment. But we were seated inside the restaurant, away from the mall traffic, and were most pleasantly surprised at the special menu that was offered. Perhaps the BEST Focaccia Bread on the planet is served at Lombardi's. It was hot out of the oven and heavenly! Our pasta dishes were amazing and such huge portions. We enjoyed the house Sangria, which was filled with fresh fruit, and finished off with Lombardi's amazing Tiramisu. Mmmm!

Seriously, a $70 dinner for an additional $13 on each The Vegas Show ticket! Might be the best deal in Vegas.  Of course, please remember to tip generously for the fine service and dining experience at Lombardi's!

While meandering through the Miracle Mile Shops, we were getting hungry and happened to stumble across Lombardi's.  It was quite crowded, but we only had to wait about five minutes for a table, which was in the courtyard/patio area that was great for people watching.

Our waiter was great.  He immediately brought out some very good complimentary bread and olive oil to the table.  The menu had quite a number of selections, but the choices weren't so many that you couldn't make up your mind.  I had calamari as an appetizer and eggplant parmesan for my entree.  Both were excellent and reasonably priced.

Everyone in my party became a fan, and we will most certainly return.

My husband and I ate here before a show at the V Theatre. Absolutely the worst Italian food ever! I ordered lasagna and it was so bland and tasteless, just awful. My husband ordered Shrimp Scampi and it was so dry he had to order extra sauce. Still was not very good. We had the flatbread for an appetizer because our waiter did not offer to bring us bread (the sourdough bread basket was way better). Overall, I would never go there again, and would never recommend them to anyone. 

The only good thing about it was the outside seating area, people watching, and the access to the V Theatre.

He'st happy hour, everyone working here is very attentive. If you don't Lombardi you aren't making Vegas right. One of my favorite spots. This place has an excellent menu items for brunch, lunch and dinner. The food here is delicious. The service is wonderful ask for Manny he's the best. I recommend this place for unlimited mimosas from their brunch menu best prices. This place never disappoints. Finally line ask for Manny, best food, best prices, try it.

Great find tonight in the miracle mile shopping .  I ordered shrimp and asparagus with butatta risotto.  OMG, delish.  Sarah our server was fabulous.  My wife had the spaghetti and meatballs.  Also delish.  Great atmosphere and the patio was great for people watching.  Will definitely be back to try other dishes.

This restaurant knocks it out of the park in terms of housemade pastas.  It serves up great Italian food at reasonable prices right on the strip.  Plus, you can sit "outside" and get some of that old Aladdin feel that Planet Hollywood decided to keep (thankfully).

Both times, I've had excellent housemade pasta dishes.  While the pasta itself is very delicious, the ingredients that go into the sauces are also very interesting, making it a delicious dish.

Lombardi's also has one of the best mixed drinks I've had, the Gin Basil Smash.  I'm not huge on mixed drinks, but this is one that I've found that I love.

If I could give 4.5 stars I would. I wasn't the BEST food we ate in Vegas, but it was delicious, our service was great, we were seated right away at 7pm, which would have been impossible at other restaurants in the area, and they have (drum roll please......) A GLUTEN FREE MENU! Whew! I can't tell you how hard it is in Vegas to find gluten free food! I also do not eat meat ( I do however, eat fish).

I ordered the Shrimp and Zucchini Risotto, all I can say is mmmmmmmmm, it was sooo tasty. I don't normally eat dairy either, and I am positive this dish had cheese in it, but oh so tasty! The shrimp was cooked perfectly, and the risotto had so much intense flavor.
I would go there again in a heartbeat.
My husband who ordered basically spaghetti and meatballs, said he enjoyed his meal (getting a food review out of him is like pulling teeth).

For the gluten free menu, they have gluten free pastas, pizza crusts, risottos and more.

It is a bummer to read other negative reviews of this place. Perhaps we lucked out on getting a great server and ordered good dishes??

The prices were reasonable (for The Strip), and the ambiance was casual (it is in a mall across from the Stripper Bar), overall, 2 thumbs up from me!

We wanted to grab a quick bite nearby before the show at Zappos theater and decided to give this a try.  We didn't have much expectations and was very pleasantly surprised with the high quality of food and reasonable prices.

Service:  Hostess seated us quickly without reservation and waitress came to take our drink order right away.  The food also came up quickly.

Food: the beef carpaccio was tasty and it was slightly seared.  I had the lobster salad, which was huge and it had 1/2 a lobster (one claw and 1/2 a tail),  a lot of meat and fresh (not mysterious chunks).  The citrus vinegarette dressing was refreshing and goes perfectly with the lobster, the mango adds both tart and sweet.  All the pastas are homemade.  I had a side of spaghetti with marinara ($5.95), nicely al dente and sauce was lovely.  I inhaled both.  We also had the risotto which was perfectly cooked.  

Great meal all around,  solid value for the huge portions and tasty fresh food.

This was the best meal we had in Vegas! Perfectly cooked fish, tasty ravioli, good chopped salad and coffee soooo delicious you don't need cream or sugar. We were seated promptly and our food came out much quicker than we expected. This is in the Miracle Mile shopping center across from Popovich pet circus.

Hard to give a thing 5stars, but tempting with this restaurant, buried among the mass amount of mundane diners and tourist traps, this is true Italian, we had the clans and mussels, spaghetti and meatballs, and the spinach/ricotta ravioli 
With a bottle of Cabernet 
We were in heaven, I compared this meal to sex lol I was very satisfied 
Eat here, I insist ; )

Went there for dinner with my wife.  We sat on the outside of the restaurant next to the mini fountain.  This was great for people watching.  Also the gigantic stripper at stripper bar kept staring at me.  Anyways, we ordered the shrimp scampi appetizer and it was good.  We also shared a pizza and it was also tasty.  Nothing super fancy but still good.  I would come here again.
Great food, great atmosphere (right in royal mile)!  had a nice fancy dinner with friends, had awesome sangrias and margherita pizza.  Would return in a heartbeat!

We enjoyed our dinner here nice service and food was much better then some of the other italian/seafood spots in the miracle mile. I had the *Salmone alla Griglia 24.50 and my hubby had Fettucine Frutti di Mare 19.50  both nice and yummy we finished everything. Caesar salad little plain and skimpy but ok and flat bread and olive oil w balsamic vinegar to dip was nice. The inside was beautiful and the outside patio is nice to people watch also pretty fountain to gaze at. We will be back again.

We visited Lombardi's before going to a show. We had a reservation and our table was ready when we arrived (seems like that is rare in Las Vegas). Our wait person was attentive and made some good recommendations. I thoroughly enjoyed my halibut - cooked to perfection, and my brother enjoyed the veal. I would recommend this restaurant.

In a city with endless options.... it's surprisingly hard to find something REAL to eat. What is it with this city's obsession with burgers?

Glad we found this gem. The freshest meal we had our entire trip. My friend wanted breakfast, I wanted lunch so this was a great compromise. I found the selections  to be diverse. I got caprese, the mozzarella was incredibly great quality with delicious EVO and light seasoning. The Greek salad was awesome as well, there is only so much greasy food I can handle and vegas doesn't make it easy. My friends breakfast looked good, fresh hand cut potato hash.

$7 mimosas and then  $1 refills after that. AWESOME! They do by default serve aqua pan bottles of water, which was fine! But if you don't want to pay $3.50 for water specify tap. 

Service was extremely prompt and personal. And the management even made multiple stops by to talk to us. How refreshing!

Great "outdoor" seating on the walkway across from the fountain made for relaxing lunch and great people watching. Located inside planet Hollywood directly across from their "V theatre".

Amazing! Ordered the pepperoni pizza, came out quick, warm, and nothing short of delicious. Scrumptious bloody mary's and the Fragolino was delish. Our server was really nice and friendly. 
Loved our service and this restaurant!

Unfortunately it is my first bad review and bad experience with dining at all. It was probably the situation - wrong time/wrong place. We stopped there after show with my son and I knew that we can always find smth with "Italians". I was very hungry and eat clean, so if I eat outside I take stake or fish with vegges. So, my grilled salmon was awful...I bet it was cooked long time ago and fried (not grilled) one more time before served, as well as potato. The whole dish was dry and overfried, it looked nothing like smb posted here. Will pass this place next time.

We chose to have our reception dinner here after getting married at the chapel in the hotel. It was close and convenient. To be honest I had never eaten here and was going on reviews alone so I was a little nervous, after all I had over 20 guests to feed and impress. When our party arrived we were sat in a semi private area over 2 large tables and the servers immediately started serving water and the delicious bread and started taking everyone's drink orders. From the time we sat down until the time we left the service was on point. We never heard a guest want for anything. Every single thing husband and I tasted was on point and perfectly cooked. The calamari was just perfect and I heard this from several people. I personally had the seafood risotto as my entree and the seafood was again perfectly cooked. After we all finished I did a look around at everyone's plates and most had cleaned their plates, my parents who have been in the food business my whole life was also impressed with it all. My husband was super happy and so was I. Thank you to the staff for making our dinner go smooth, drinks full and food especially delicious!!

I bought a theater ticket which included a meal. I presented the voucher and my family was seated. The waiter was nice but we could tell she did not want to service customers with vouchers. They gave us bread with olive oil, cheese and balsamic vinegar which was not good. The meal came with a house salad which was just ok. I had the chicken Marsala which was bland and had not much flavor. When dinner was finished, the waitress brought a bill with the cost of the drinks and in large red ink a suggested amount of about $100.00 for dinner so tip needs to be at least $20.00!  I am sorry that your  employer does not pay you enough but I should not be expected to compensate poor service.

Good food. Very nice and attentive wait staff. Was a group of unruly kids in there for hours and they were professional about keeping the tables around them happy and keeping the kids, who were ignored by there parents, happy.
Marsala was good and I loved the bread. Thanks for dinner guys!

Only two reviews from this place- wow! OK, so I'm going to give you the good the bad and the ugly.
My friends and I used to LOVE this place because they offered an all you can drink Mimosa/Bellini special on Sundays. We could have shut this place down, but we more then made up for it with all the food we ordered.This must have been back in 2007-2009 or something. The bread is amazing! If you don't like pasta then go for the anti-pasti platters and you won't be sorry. If you want some peace and quiet, opt for a table indoors. To people watch, sit on their patio. Fair warning, the patio seating is rather tight.
Fast forward to current day and I had to take away one star. I think our waitress was having an off day so I don't really want to blame everything on her BUT it played a huge part in our overall experience, which is the bottom line when you dine at any restaurant. Anyway, I was trying to be friendly, joking with her about their old specials while my friends were looking over the drink menu. She evidently wasn't having any of it. We wanted to order the focaccia bread appetizer which is a slam dunk, but she suggested we order ourselves entries because it would come with a side of focaccia. We ended up ordering a salad and two entries. One of my gal pals and I ordered a Pumpkin Martini each. Our dishes arrived before the bread, but we didn't think anything of it because we were so hungry. 
Our water glasses were all empty along with our adult beverage glasses. Being that the food is rather rich, we stopped eating. Our waitress never bothered to come by and see if everything was OK so we flagged down a different one to refill our glasses.  Under my breathe I quietly said to my friends, "Our waitress is terrible." I think she heard me because after that she finally stopped by to see if we wanted another martini. At this point I was annoyed because she was catering to her other tables more than ours. I asked about our order of focaccia. She looked at us funny and then said she was so sorry it didn't come. The next words she uttered were just plain wrong... "Ummm, do you still want me to put in the order for you?" Granted we were a table of 3 and now very upset women who only came to this place specifically for the bread. Nodding yes, we all kind of grumbled to ourselves and promised to take a break from this place.

I came here with a bachelorette, and they were very accommodating to large parties! I had the lombardi's foccacia, and I must say it was excellent. We had great service and sat outside. It was Saturday night so the place was busy, but the manager came by and gave us all a free shot! All in all, this place was one of the better places we ate and we had to eat here last minute due to a mess up with our reservation! One girl does not eat carbs, and they managed to make her something without carbs, at an Italian restaurant!

I had a very enjoyable meal here.  I did not have a package deal, I just ordered off the menu.

The food was all very good, the bread with oil vinegar and parmesean (YuMMy!!), side salad and the recommended pasta, Agnolotti.  I found the pasta to be very fresh with lots of good flavor.  Prices are high, but they are in line with other Vegas restaurants.

The best thing about the meal was the server, Alvaro.  He is a delight!  He was pleasant, helpful (made a good entree suggestion) and funny.  Just the kind of server I look for in a nice restaurant.
We had mojito and calamari! Man!!! It was delicious!! Plus fantastic service! Just perfect!!

While in town on business, I had an early dinner appointment open up, so I decided to come to Planet Hollywood so I could eat & maybe do some shopping as well before heading back to the airport. I looked up the restaurants online & inteded on going to Yolo's (a Mexican cantina inside the casino), but as I was walking through the Miracle Mile shops, I came across this place & started craving Italian.

The ambiance is nice. They have a setting for most every need... long & secluded tables for large groups to make it feel family-style, regular seating inside, bar seating with a TV, or patio seating "outside" the restaurant to people watch. The music is kinda loud coming from the Miracle Mile walkway & the A/C was up way too high, so it was freezing cold, but the decor is a nice cross between olde world Italia & contemporary flare, so, overall, it was pleasant.

I came around 3pm, which is after the lunch crowd & before the dinner crowd, so it was pretty empty. They were still serving off the lunch menu, which I'm glad about, because it was a tad bit pricy, so I can imagine what their dinner prices are like.

As for the food..... delish!! I ordered the Paglia e Fieno which is made with tagliolini pasta (like a flat linguini), chicken, mushrooms, truffle oil & cream sauce. I've never had tagliolini before. Typically, I would've substituted that for fettuccini noodles, but since I've been trying to "try something new" in 2013, I kept it as-is. Glad I did too... I really liked it! I did substitute broccoli instead of chicken, & they cooked it perfectly... not all mushy, yet not raw. The mushrooms were tasty without being overbearing & the cream sauce had a nice consistency & was garlicy. It was a terriffic dish!

I do have to note... after reading another Yelper's review about how good their house bread is, but the difficulty they had in actually receiving any, I was looking forward to getting some which came with my meal, according to the menu. Well, it didn't come out with my meal. After a few moments, I realized this & stopped my waitress asking her, "excuse me, does this come with bread?" She suddendly seemed a bit irritated & replied, "oh, do you want some?" This was almost exactly the same snippy reply the other Yelper got, so I'm guessing this was the same waitress &, no, she wasn't just having an off day. And when she brought the bread out without any butter or anything & I asked her for some oil & vinegar, she acted like it was such a task! Very strange, because other than this bread ordeal, she was a pretty good waitress.... what is it about this bread?! Lol (Minus 1 star)

Anywho, like I said, other than that, the experience was fine & the food was great. I'll probably be back.

Very nice surprise for a free vouchered dining experience. 

My husband and I received a free voucher for this restaurant and it was well worth it. We went at a time that it was not busy and had pretty decent service.

The food is what makes this restaurant it was hot, fresh, and most importantly authentic. The pasta was made from scratch along with the bread.

The waitress was efficient not overly friendly but did her job well I would have paid for this dining experience and highly recommends when you are in Vegas.

We only come here for one dish:

Paglia e Fieno with extra mushrooms add garlic!

Service is always good!

Free bread with oil and vinegar.

Best place to eat at Planet Hollywood

Good food and great service. I thought the portions were ok for the price (about $15-25/entree) but everything was presented nicely. They even bring around a plate of parmesean cheese to sprinkle on your food once you get it. They didn't seem to have draft beer though because I ordered a Heineken and it automatically came in a bottle. I would recommend this place if you're already at the Planet Hollywood or Miracle Mile Shops but I don't think I would make the trip down just to eat here....nothing special, just a normal Italian restaurant.

We just got finished with two days of food poisoning that ruined my vegas trip.

Went there on Thursday evening for dinner, I ordered the blackberry mule, bruschetta and chicken parm, wife order tagliolini scampi.  Waiter was nice enough, started us out with bread and olive oil vinegar dip.  Bread seemed a bit old and so didn't the olive oil but ok,  Mule was nothing to write home over, bruschetta was actually good, but very watery ,  the bread warmed up.  Meals came, immediately my wife said taste this and stuck a shrimp on my plate, it was tough and with a strong fishy taste.  The chicken parm was horrible, dry, thin and flavorless.  We knew we made a mistake we each tried another shrimp to make sure, and I ate around on the chicken to check the other zones.  We ate the pasta and wanted to leave.  We told the waiter it wasn't very good he apologized and just brought us the bill.  Now we hand him the cc and then see him head to the back where he stands there shooting the breeze with his coworkers for about 10 minutes.  i just wanted out.  About three hours later sure enough both the wife and I are puking in our hotel rooms,  not a good way to spend a night in a $300 room.  The next day was full of cramps and trips to the bathroom, since that had been pretty much the only meal other than some pastries that morning we nailed it to that meal.  

If you have ever drove to vegas from California you know there are not many rest stops this experience was horrible 

if you are management reading this for authentication we were check 621343 table 12 time stamped 8/24/17 7:00 pm
Fantastic food and outstandingly friendly and helpful staff with great service. Highly recommend you dine here while in Vegas.

Just ate here on a Weds night. Easy to get a table.  Read the review and I can't speak to others experience but everything we had was delicious. We had the Fritto Mixto, Risotto house special, lobster ravioli and brick even pizza. Everything was delicious, and the service and atmosphere were very good. I would recommend it if you're in the Miracle mile mall by Planet Hollywood casino.

Very rude server, inattentive. Spilled soda on my step dad and just walked away. Snorted when my mom didn't want an extra soup or salad.

Service aside, the food is actually tasty.  The pizza is thin crust, but it isn't really different from the Chef's foccaccia bread.  The tomato basil pasta is a timeless classic, and the salmon salad  lunch special was a steal.  The portion size of salmon will not disappoint.

I'm usually good at reading Yelp reviews prior to trying a place out, but I thought it was convenient so just jumped ship.  Don't make my mistake.

My wife, daughter and I had dinner here and we all were quite disappointed. Much like most of the dining in the Planet Hollywood ( miracle mile mall), the food here is iffy at best. Overpriced and not very tasty. My wife and I had pasta, over cooked, and not very good flavor in the red sauce. My daughter had the lobster salad,and could not eat it. It was tough and chewy and lacked any lobster flavor. Terrible dining. Nice atmosphere but skip the food!!
Great food & service at affordable prices!! We enjoyed our anniversary dinner here and we were surprised how good and nice it was!

Pretty awesome choice when you need a vegetarian menu and a gluten free menu for your group of picky eaters. Lots of great dishes to choose from that will satisfy everyone in your group. Lots of different pastas, whole wheat, gluten free, lots of risottos, pizza, seafood and more. This place has a casual but classy atmosphere. We chose to sit inside as it was a bit quieter than the noisy faux patio mall area. The servers were all really accommodating and friendly too. I would definitely come here again. But beware of those annoying ladies taking photos of your table claiming they're "free". Once they bring the photo back to you in an ugly frame, they want you to pay $40 for it. Save your time and get your server to take your picture with your own camera. That's free.

Loved their food, Loved their location! 

I really enjoyed the fake terrace/patio setting. I would like to sit outside more often, but its either too hot and sunny during the day or too cold at night, so this is perfect! Plus I think there was a fountain show or something going on. 

It is in the Miracle Mile shops so you can shop afterwards to burn off the calories! 

I had the Fettucine Frutti di Mare and it was amazing!! I was only in Vegas for 4 days and came here twice and ordered the same dish. I usually prefer the cream-based sauces but this dish was GREAT!! I thought there was a decent amount of seafood in it and the texture of the pasta was amazing. The bread was good too.

FYI: Their lunch and dinner portions were the same (at least my dish was) which was a pleasant surprise for me since I like to eat :)
To be honest I really liked this place. The food was amazing and priced fairly decently and came out in a breeze. Give this place a shot!

I'll make it quick: the best thing about this place was the amazing customer service and how fast the food came out which could be a bad thing depending on how you look at it. 

Our server was great and she appears to really like her job. 

As for the food, none of us were impressed. I got the risotto with scallops. For almost $20 I figured I would have gotten at least 3 scallops...nope only 2. Scallops were great but not the actual risotto. My daughters ordered the lasagna and alfredo, and the hubby ordered some meat dish. None of us finished our food and that says a lot. For the price we paid I guess I was expecting more. The fresh bread when we were first seated was nice. Fresh bread is always a bonus. 

So one and done.
Fabulous staff and food!! Located in the Miracle Mile off Planet Hollywood. I had the Eggplant Parm and it was fabulous!! I do have to say they have the best tiramisu in town!!!

I was recommend by a Good friend to try this place out for myself. Located in the middle of Planet Hollywood.
As I approached the entrance, I asked to sit in the outside patio area. Such a relaxing spot to dine in at. The atmosphere of this Restaurant is very appealing and most of very romantic. They have done a great job in setting the mood to relax and enjoy your meal.The lighting and the music and most of all the small wares and the linen are a added bonus to enjoying your meal.
My server was very attentive. Sara. Your an asset to this establishment. I hope they see this in you how attentive you where with your Guests. Your personality and smile are the key to your success.Don't lose it. 
I ordered the Chicken Marsala with mashed potatoes and vegetables and the whole plate was very good. The dish also came with their version of bread and olive oil. Now the bread is also made to order and baked in a Wood Oven for such a better taste.
For Desert I had their home made Tiramisu. I was in haven.
Recommendation sit in the patio area,if you like to people watch.
25/100 Yelp Challenge.(2017)

I was sooo looking forward to some yummy Italian food and this place was just disappointing. My waiter, not very enthusiastic. I won't throw her under the bus but she took forever to bring out the bread (very crunchy). I ordered the lobster ravioli which was much less than impressive. The lobster tasted too fishy and the ravioli had a rubber, chewy texture. I wasn't even about to take chances with dessert. Next time I crave Italian this will be the last place I think of.

I love the food at lombardi's...so yummy!..both the brunch and lunch menu are wonderful..risotto is so creamy and the gnocchi is to die for...they also offer bottomless mimosas with the brunch menu...they offered it before with the lunch menu..but i guess they're not doing that anymore..which really sucks..but anyways, i would give 5 stars if it weren't for the disgustingly rude host..i'm not sure if he's the manager or the host..but right when you walk in, it seems like he doesn't even want to help you..i love the waiters though, everyone else is so sweet and they offer great service...but the dude in the front has a stick up his ass...he's always there whenever we've gone, so he might be the manager...kinda sucks..but definitely go for the food...and just try to avoid the dude in the front..

Let me say that I LOVED Lombardi's Romagna Mia.  I actually dined here solo because the husband wasn't hungry so I took advantage of the opportunity to get some serious Italian on.  The location is in the Miracle Mile Shops in Planet Hollywood and they have an inside and an "outside" seating area.  I sat "outside".  

First, my server was amazing.  She was friendly, helpful, took care of me and made me feel welcome.  Just wish I remembered her name.  Ah well.

I started with the beef carpaccio and it was delicious. it came with a pile of arugula, lemon and capers.  I had planned to just eat half, but I cleaned that plate, it was so tasty!  The lemon was perfect with the beef.  SO GOOD!

Then I had the lobster and crab ravioli.  Also AMAZING.  The flavors were so delicate and tasty and the ravioli were floating in a brandy crustacean sauce that was a creamy pink sauce and my mouth is watering right now thinking about this dish.  It was a daily special item, but if they have it when you go, trust me, it's YUM.

Before my meal I had their sangria and it was good... on the sweet side, then I had a glass of wine with my food.  

It was a wonderful meal, I left full and happy and it hit my pocketbook to the tune of around $50 plus tip.  Worth every penny.  I will definitely return, especially since my timeshare is right across the street!

Very good! Stopped by for lunch on a Tuesday without reservations and were seated right away. They have a lot to offer on their menu. I had the shrimp scampi pasta and my husband had the spicy rigatoni with mushrooms. The food was great and we're going to add this place to one of our must stops the next time we're in Vegas.
Service  salad  other food . I am 100% italian and i wasnt happy at all. So DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY . Go to McDonald's

Updated review based on our second visit.

We went back a second time since our first visit was outstanding. This time was different because we did a dinner and show combo pack. They asked if we had purchased the deal and took the tickets. They put the vouchers in the middle of the table. We waited over 10 minutes for someone to great us. While waiting we made an observation that everyone with the tickets on the table were waiting but people who came in after, without tickets in their table, were awarded quick service. My husband commented about that as the host walked by. The host came over and got our drink order. I asked about the drink special and he said it was only at the bar but we could move there. We did hoping it would be better service. It wasn't. We also only had a choice of four meals unless we wanted to upgrade for 10-18 dollars a piece. We had spent plenty so decided to go off the choices included. He got the tilapia and it was pretty good. I got the only vegetarian option, fettuccine Alfredo. It wasn't disgusting but the sauce wasn't as good as canned from the grocery store and the noodles were not fully cooked. This was nothing like our first experience with service or food quality. After reading the other reviews it seems that if you go as a regular customer it is wonderful. If you purchase the combo package with a show, it is a different and not desirable experience.  

Excellent food! I had the macaroni and cheese and my husband had a daily special. Mine was wonderful and he said that his was one of the best meals ever! Our server was attentive and kind. We are in Vegas for our wedding and our waitress made a special design for our dipping sauce. This is the only restaurant we are making sure to have again on our trip!

Well it was a pretty darn good meal. My friend had a special - Gorgonzola with pear inside pasta with walnuts in a white sauce. 5+ stars. I had chicken parmesan and it was 4+.  

For dessert.  Chocolate cupcake thing with vanilla ice cream.  Yummmmm. 

We told the photo girl and the elderly violinist "no thanks" and they graciously left us alone.  

Good place to eat before the V theatre.  We ate before the Marc Savard Hypnotist show and the show was AWESOME too!  A fine evening!

Made reservations for this restraunt,  showed up after the show to find out they could not serve since the system was down.  It was busy at the other restraunts after the show and had to wait nearly an hour for dinner!  A phone call would have been nice.

Let's say service was good... 

let's end it there.. Food was pretty bland.. I had the eggplant and it looked more like a piece of egg plop. Spaghetti had a strange taste to it, like the sauce was burnt... Figured out later that the garlic was the bad taste and it was killing the whole taste.  

So many other great places for food in this city.. If your a visitor don't waste your time here....

I really loved this place. The ambience, food, and customer service. We needed to find a place to eat before watching Vegas! The Show.  This wasn't too far and we were able to eat and relax. Everyone of the wait staff had difference accents so it made it feel as if we were on vacation. It's pretty pricey but what do you expect... it's Las Vegas! I ordered the Spaghetti and was able to split with a friend. We both enjoyed it. Thanks again!

got really hungry shopping around the miracle mile and happened to find Lombardi's there wasn't many people eatting there so we didn't have to wait and the service was excellent. The bread they give you looks like a pizza and it was really good. I ordered the spaghetti with marinara sauce and it was delicious. I love really good marinara sauces and this place makes it well.

The girls and I come here almost every time we're in Vegas. Awesome bottomless Mimosas during brunch for a great price. Followed by Fat Tuesdays which is in the same mall:) 

The free bread with oil and balsamic vinegar is yummy in my tummy. And you can never go wrong with their pasta dishes!

I'll admit it. Italian is on the bottom of my top cuisine list. Most dishes can be made at home and it's hard to find a place that actually stands out and makes you want to come back. 

For me, Lombardi's is the epitomy of this, if not worse. It's your typical sub-par Italian restaurant that presents itself as high-class but really consists of waiters who dread their jobs and chefs who have never used seasonings outside of salt and pepper and consider the microwave their utensil of choice. I really didn't expect much more in the first place.

I ordered the Lobster/Crab Ravioli special, which I tend to gravitate to in the rare case that I do go to an Italian restaurant and they actually have it. This was probably the worst I've had. The dough was under-cooked, the filling was just some mushy paste that barely had any seafood flavor, and the portion was pretty small for the price. It was just bleh, for lack of a better term. If you're going to have a dish that's considered a special, at least do it right.

Service was mediocre at best. We had a group of 10 or so and the waiter always took forever. Now I wonder why we even came here considering all the options Vegas has to offer...
Delicious Osso Bucco and the kids loved the spaghetti and meatballs.  Conveniently located near the theatre to watch the Variety Show.

I have no issue saying I'm wrong. After going to Lombardi's for a second time last night, I will be a regular at this location for a very, very long time.

I wanted gluten free pizza, and we were staying in PH, so we decided to grab some pizza from Lombardi's and then walk around. My husband convinced me to give them another chance and we sat down for some lunch. This time, we grabbed a couple cocktails, one Cosmopolitan creation and an Italian Margarita. Delicious. My drink was perfect, not too sweet, just perfect. His was just the way he wanted it, a little sweeter but with a nice bitter kick and a little salty. Yum.

Now, then they told me they were out of GF crusts. I was about to walk out, but I wanted to give this another go around and ordered their caprese salad and the Paglia a Fieno. Both of them were truly unbelievably good, and I am so glad we went back. 

The salad was perfect. Perfect marinated tomatoes, nice tang of vinaigrette, wonderfully fresh basil and oh that mozzarella. A little smokey, very smooth, the server, Matt, cracked some fresh pepper on top and BAM. MAGIC. I could eat that salad everyday for the rest of my life and never get sick of it.

On to the pasta. If I could eat pasta and never gain another pound, this pasta would be my breakfast, lunch and dinner every single day. Amazing. The chicken was just slightly overcooked, but I still would have eaten that chicken anytime as long as it was in that pasta or that pasta was my reward. Gluten free pasta, mushrooms, a little hit of truffle oil and a perfect cream sauce. This is not an Olive Garden cream sauce. This is garlic, plus cream and then some cheese.
