This is a sauce that probably got them Zagat rated. This is my go to pasta. Anytime. Anywhere. A-FREAKING-MAZING.

Finally, let me comment on the service. Last time, the service was horrible and bad enough for me to almost walk out because why am I paying this much for food when the service is wretched?  This time? This is an example of why this restaurant is Zagat rated. First of all, I saw the manager walking around and checking on tables and greeting guests. I firmly believe this is a manager's job and should be done everywhere. Our server, Matt, was perfect. He brought salad plates, explained the dishes, described the drinks perfectly, made us feel good about our food and drink choices, brought us freshly grated parmesan cheese with our meal, offered red chili flakes (a welcoming addition to the pasta), brought us entree plates since we had told him we were sharing our dish, filled the water glasses all the time and was just very warm and friendly. He told me that the reason they do not have the GF pizza crust is because they're revamping the crust so that it tastes more like regular pizza instead of a generic GF pizza and so that it is the size of their normal pizzas. The manager came over and said the same thing and was very friendly as well.

Sorry about the novel, and I normally don't change my mind based off of one re-visit (and I normally do not revisit after that kind of experience), but this one was perfect, and I am confident this will continue for our many visits to come.

Food was average to below average. I had better at major Italian chains for half the host. You pay for the location. Me and my wife got two salads and two simple pasta dishes for $70 no wine no dessert.

I was  disappointed to chose this restaurant for breakfast with my family. I order eggs Benedict, Belgium waffles but not really good therefore the price for that is not really worth it. By the end the server add 18% Of gratuity  but on the received did not say or explain how the gratuity will be add. On the received must say " GRATUITY WILL ADD ON CERTAIN AMOUNT OF PEOPLE "

We received a free voucher for dinner here, being told it was a really nice restaurant. Funny thing is, when we got there we were given a menu with only 4 choices on it. Still we had an open mind, they brought bread and then salads, everything was looking good. We both ordered the chicken marsala, and wow for a nice italian restaurant they totally messed up. The chicken tasted like they pan fried it real quick with no seasoning, then poured a watered down version of marsala, and to top it off, canned mushrooms. To say the least, olive garden chicken marsala blows this place away. Don't get me wrong, we ate for free, so I get giving us the cheap crap, but seems silly to not try to serve a good product even to the people who got comps, we might actually wanna come back and pay. So by all costs avoid this place if your looking for good Italian food.

Another great dinner with my beautiful bride.

 Server Sarah was great. Laughed at my bad jokes. They were accomodating to changes to the menu. 

 The cheese cake was too good to share with her though. 
#AnniversaryWeekinVegas #UnconditionalLove
Pasta was delicious and steak was juicy and melts in your mouth. It is not a big name restaurant but food was definitely better than those famed celebrity restaurants.

Overpriced. Portions are small. Food is NOT good. My fettuccine noodles were hard when it was placed on my table. Service is good. Oh and to add chicken to fettuccine will cost you $4. Spend your $ elsewhere!
I was surprised the food was actually pretty good and decently priced. We received great service as well!

Lombardis was great again!Every time i come to Vegas its my must visit place.Great service with the smile from the beginning to the end.Paglia e fieno is my favorite pasta.If you like people watch then sit on the patio.Thank you Daniela and thank you Lombardis.

Delicious! We got comped a dinner and show tickets. There's a separate menu for this. You get bread, salad, and an entree. I had the fettuccine Alfredo. It was amazing. My husband had rigatoni bolognese and that was delicious too. The service was great. We sat "outside" and got to see the fountain show. I would come here again and pay for a meal.

It's very rare to have Gluten Free option for Italian as good as this. My wife who has the allergy couldn't have been happier. The Penne Alfredo Pasta was delicious, I had the grilled chicken and she added shrimp, both were impressive. Probably the best thing about the meal was the GF Focaccia bread with olive oil, Parmesan and balsamic probably would have to be the best GF bread i've had. It comes out as a thing pizza shaped crust but soooo much better than most. If their pizza is made on this same "crust" it would have to be superb. Do yourself a favor and try this especially if you have a gluten allergy not many can compete with this!
Had our 25th anniversary dinner there before a show. The staff made it special for us. Great food and nice staff. We will be returning on our next trip.

I am a little surprised by the negative reviews because we had a great experience. We arrived pretty early (we were on Texas time so we were starving), and it took us a bit of time to be seated. If you open at 11, and I come at 11:02, I expect you to already be open and ready. 

We started out with the free foccacia bread which was great. I really enjoyed it, and it was a huge portion. 

I ordered the paglia e fiene, and my husband ordered the spaghetti with meatballs. We both really enjoyed our meals. Mine was super creamy and fresh, and I loved the mushrooms. The chicken was tender and had great flavor. My husband raved about his spaghetti and meatballs and actually wanted to go back the next day. (I nixed that. Too many restaurants too little time.) He said the meatballs were not dry at all, and had great flavor.

I was also confused by the complaints about the patio. It's a mall, people. I didn't mind it at all and thought it was nice to sit by the fountain. 

We would definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

I had a 2pm reservation to meet with a friend at LRM for lunch. My friend showed up a 1/2 hour late but the staff at the host stand were so friendly and extremely accommodating they had no problem waiting the extra time for my friend to arrive. Charese came to greet us (the GM) and sat us at a fantastic table next the main drag of the Miracle Mile shops where we had a great view of the fountains  next to the 'V' theater. 

We were on a pre-fixed menu which consisted of a very tasty mixed blend salad with a savory vinaigrette dressing served with a crunchy flat bread. We had the seafood pasta which when it arrived didn't fill the plate and looked a bit small. I realized after the main course that it was definitely more than enough and I probably would not have been able to eat any more than I did. We ended the meal with a cappuccino and their delicious Tiramisu which had surprise dark chocolate chips in the center. Now, I'm of the school where you do not throw chocolate onto a Tiramisu just because it's brown and looks like coco. It's not a chocolate cake, it's a COFFEE dessert. But I have to say that the dark chocolate chips made the desert taste like a cafe mocha which was delightful.

All-in-all I would say that my experience with LRM was well worth a visit to Planet Hollywood Casino and the Miracle Mile Shops. 

Kudos to Charese who was such a joy to talk to, and to Sarah (our waitress) who served us with a smile.

Just okay. We came rather late, right before closing. The food is expensive for just pasta. We ordered chicken parmesan and the lasagna. While waiting, we wanted to order drinks that were on special but we were told we had to go to the bar for that, even though there were only 2 other tables being waited on. A few minutes later, the waiter said it was fine and we could order from our table instead. They were okay, nothing special but the price was right - 2 for $10. The food was hot and seemed fresh. I didn't like the taste of the lasagna at all. I couldn't tell what was wrong with it but wouldn't order it again. The piece was also very small for $20 and no sides. The chicken parm was much better but again, portion was small for $24.

Lombardi's  at Planet Hollywood.
Don't buy tickets with dinner coupons we found this out the hard way the menu was limited with 3 dishes one being worst than the other.
We sent back the Chicken Marsala right away it was pressed chicken embarrassing to even list this on the menu then ordered the pasta both dishes again terrible.
Olive Garden better.
 Lesson learned.

Excellent steak! One of my favorite steaks of all time. Very tender and season to perfection. They also offer free photos and a awesome patio in the miracle mile mall.I personally had a awesome meal and a great time.

We rolled in Six deep and was greeted and seated. They presented us with Menus and Sourdough Bread with Olive Oil.. We ordered Calamari for an Appetizer.  It was Delish we ended up ordering 3 orders of Calamari lol.

I ordered a Cesar Salad and a Dry Aged Rib eye Steak with Grilled Mushrooms with Steamed Vegetables and Garlic Mash Potatoes.

The Cesar Salad was good ,fresh ingredients and a nice size portion .

The Star was the Rib Eye Steak . Tender , Flavorful  . Just Yummy and it hit the spot.
 
I would definitely eat there again.
Such a very nice place to eat in Vegas! We asked them to serve us real quick and they did! Food was ready in 15 min. Such a nice place!

I like this place. It's conveniently located in planet hollywood's miracle mile shops. It's a good value for the money and you get dollar drink refills on peach bellinis and mimosas. We came here for lunch on a Saturday and the food was pretty good and service quick. I ordered fettuccine alrfredo w/ chicken and spinach and my fiancé got the lasagna. His meal coulda used some help but mine was pretty good. 
Our meal came with flat bread which was also just decent, it coulda used a little help. Overall, the food could've been seasoned better.

I've been here a few times and I'm very happy with their delivery of great food and service. Close to authentic as possible, their offering is prepared with great attention to detail and splash of Italian passion.
The service is always personable and thoughtful. Comfortable and yet treated with class.
The "Pollo Arrosto" was my order but we had varieties of pasta. The Vongole's white wine, garlic sauce is subtle and yet addicting enough to want to run your baguette through and through after you're finished.
Hard to find great Italian on the westside.
This was hands down the best Italian food I've ever eaten in Vegas.  I had the Fettuccini Alfredo.  The pasta was amazing.  You could tell it was freshly made noodles.  We will be back!!!
Enjoyed a delicious meal of chicken Marsala served with mashed potatoes, steamed zucchini/yellow squash. Just great!
I've had better food from a microwave dinner. Potatos we're dry, food was flavorless. Pasta wasnt cooked right.

I had a free dinner voucher and picked this place. They offer a salad and choice of entree. My salad was great with freshly shredded carrot on top. The rigatoni bolognese was delicious with tasty sauce.

I had a moment of weakness and ordered a lava cake too, it was a little too much. Over the top sweet, but if you like that kind of thing...

My only bad experience was the mall music blasting on the patio (sit inside) and that if the two stalls in the ladies room, only one had a working lock. Ugh!

Received a free dinner from attending a time share and the food was pretty good. Inside the mall area connected to the Planet Hollywood hotel. Italian restaurant, nicely decorated with a intimate atmosphere. The chicken Marcela with potatoes was good as well as the Cesar salad.

I will be honest   The food was just ok been to plenty of Italian restaurants and this lace serves small portions and the service was pretty bad we never got a water refilled and for a so called home made pasta place it just doesn't cut it ,,,for around 18'.00 a plate which isn't high it should either fill you upor at least tantalize your taste buds ,,,it did neither,,,my stepson had lasagne which tasted an looked like some version of a Mac and cheese dish...won't be back went on jan 3 2013
Didn't care much for the food. Fettuccine Alfredo was horrible, cannolis awful. Only reason I'm giving 2 star because wetter was very nice.

Was looking for a sit down place to eat, I thought  the food was very good, and the atmosphere was really cool, we sat outside in the mall, lots to see, fountains and old time European feel.  Depending on what you order you can expect the prices to vary. I recommend you give it a try.

The pasta was homemade, sauces were done very well although a little sweet for me.  We go here often when at the Planet Hollywood.  We love the food and most dishes are amazing.  The focaccia bread is awesome.  Try this place out and really enjoy good Italian food on the strip.

Food and service were pretty good here. I'll give this place that. My friend and I went here because we had coupons for a comedy show immediately afterwards. The pre-theatre menu has a very limited selection, but the available choices are decent.

Our meal started with the complimentary foccacia bread with rosemary olive oil and parmesan cheese. Then we got our salads. I got the Caesar salad while my friend got the house salad. Then came the entrees. I got the Fettucine Alfredo while my friend got the Rigatoni Bolognese. All of the food was pretty good.

What keeps this place from getting anything above 3 stars was when we got the bill at the end. The meals were free since we had the coupons from the V theatre across the way, but we would still have to leave tip. The value of the entire meal was listed as $70! I was floored when I saw that number because there was no way the meals we got could have cost that much. For fun we went ahead and added up the cost of everything, assuming the foccacia bread was complimentary. The total was only about $50. When we added the cost of the foccacia bread, the total value was $58. Where did the remaining $12 come from? And if the foccacia bread is in fact complimentary, where did that extra $20 come from? Even with the 8.1% sales tax, the highest total ends up being $63. There was no way we were going to leave a 15-20% tip based on $70, when that was much higher than actual value of the meal!

This is probably the better place inside the Miracle Mall to go to for a pre-theatre meal. Just be warned, the free meal does not include everything on the dinner menu and they will try to squeeze more money out of you thru drinks, desserts, and tip. But then again, this is Vegas so any place can try to reel you in with something "free" and still take your money!

We have been going here for the last 12 years... Now today we are having lunch and my wife orders a Moscow mule .... We have to give up our drivers license to secure the copper cup?... Wtf... Seriously... So turned off I will never go there again... The restaurant must be having some real issues... Food is always good , but this policy is off the hook ridiculous ..... 
My guess is they are in real trouble ...... Watch for a new restaurant opening soon.....

Weer eens lekker Italiaans gegeten. Eten is heerlijk en perfecte bediening, Op zijn Italiaans kun je zeggen. Porties zijn erg groot !! Tip hou hier rekening mee bij het  bestellen. Als je even weg wil bij de Amerikaanse  keuken zeker doen. 

Karel en Mercedes  sept 2014

We went as a family of 12. Service was great! Food was aweful and bland. Why pay $18-$30 a plate and not get the quality of food you would expect at this price band. I wouldn't come here again. We should have gone next door to cheeseburger lounge.
The only thing that they have going for them is the salads & the parmesan cheese. The cannoli was very dry and the ice cream is not a ice cream. The waitress was very nice.

My friend and I enjoyed our dinner very much.  The server was excellent and never let my glass get empty.  The manager asked us if everything was good which we appreciated very much.  Fast service, good food and beautiful ambience.
Food was pretty decent for a last minute pick. We chose to eat here because it is right in front of the V theater and we were waiting for a show.   Food was good and service excellent.

Good fettuccine Alfredo, I am spoiled due to a place called Lo Cocos in Berkeley, but it wasn't bad. Service was Good we were checked on by whom im asummimg was the manager, more than our server. But the server was extremely nice. My wife had some huge shrimp on her plate...and those were awesome.

AWFUL
AWFUL
AWFUL

Here are some things I had issues with:
- I ordered their  "2 eggs any style" dish, but THEY REFUSED to make boiled eggs.
-I ordered eggs over hard, but they UNDERCOOKED them 
-When I asked them to cook it a little more, they BURNED them.
-The sausage was tasteless. 
-No free refills on iced coffee when coffee is unlimited. THE ONLY DIFFERENCE IS ONCE HAS ICE!

Nice decor, but sketchy bathrooms. They must've spent their time and money on decorating and not food.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would.

Good was amazing!  Hubby ordered spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered chicken Parmesan. Both very good, as well as the bread that is served with your meal. 
  The end of the meal was unfortunately not great, as the manager of the restaurant was being very rude and disrespectful to his wait staff. I feel bad for the people that work here, working under that man!  He was slamming chairs around our table while we were sitting at our table. He made it very uncomfortable being there!  
  Waitstaff was awesome!  Food was awesome. Manger not a nice man and I think a jerk!!!

Expensive and not good!!! 

But I love the bottomless Bellini and mimosa.

Save your hard earned $$ and go somewhere else unless you really are hungry or you want bottomless drink/alcohol for a less expensive price compared to other restaurants.

This was a great place to eat inside the miracle mile shops. The spaghetti and meatballs were made exactly as they should've been. The wine that was suggested by the waiter paired well with the meal. The portions  are large so be careful about ordering too many appetizers and eating too much of the bread.

Here just vacationing from California. Had cravings for Italian food and came across this restaurant inside the miracle mile in planet Hollywood Resort Casino. Sat outside, wasn't busy so was seated quickly. Our server Kyle was excellent! Greeted and welcomed us. My sister has food allergies and Kyle took his time explaining and getting her order correctly, needed to modify the food to her liking. Food came out fairly quickly. Enjoyed the complimentary bread and balsamic vinegar& oil dipping sauce. 
If it wasn't for the exceptional service we received from Kyle, I would rate the food 3.5-4 stars.
We shared two delicious pasta dishes!  The bread was excellent.  The service was great.  A lovely place to celebrate my birthday.

Dont do it!. Had Carpaccio that was cooked on the outside, I knew right off the bat this place was not going to be authentic. The lobster ravioli was ok. Try another place, olive garden is better than this place.

My party of 6 all thought this place was pretty good, although I'd argue that for the portion sizes, it was a bit overpriced.

We made reservations on Open Table for Saturday night at 7pm & we were seated immediately, We opted to sit in the "outdoor space" which was funny since it's not really outdoors, but still, better for people watching on the faux patio.

3 of our girls opted to split a bottle of wine while the other 3 all ordered individual cocktails. Personally, I ordered the sparkling rose and it was only ok--definitely not served cold enough for my tastes.

The daily specials had a roasted tomato soup and both my friend and I were interested in trying it, but for $8.50 for a cup of soup, we opted to split it in case one of us didn't like it. Fortunately the soup was delicious, but again, $8.50 for a cup of tomato soup is a bit ridiculous...it wasn't a bowl, it was a CUP.

For our entrees, 2 of us opted for their streak ravioli daily special, 1 got the veggie pizza, 1 got spaghetti and meatballs, 1 fettuccine alfredo, and 1 spaghetti with tomato sauce and basil (I forgot the name of the actual dish). Everyone really enjoyed their meals. The ravioli was very small which basically forced me to order dessert (lol), but it was good none the less. I ordered the chocolate lava cake and while delicious, it was REALLY REALLY rich and I couldn't eat more than half without getting a serious stomachache. PROTIP: this is a dessert to SHARE! It's small but deadly!

The bread and dip (oil, parm cheese, and balsamic I think) they serve is very good and we went through a lot of it. The service was mostly okay, although it did seem to take our server a while give us our check and then take it back after we put our money in. 

Finally, I'd like to apologize on behalf of my two EXTREMELY IMMATURE FRIENDS for drawing penises all over the table!!! LOL They cover the tables with paper and give you crayons (I have no idea why, I wouldn't recommend this place for kids & it seems like you're asking for trouble by giving drunk people crayons). Our friends thought drawing penises everywhere and then putting their plates over them was hilarious until the bus boy started picking up the plates and they had forgotten that they drew them underneath. He skipped away chuckling and our waiter made sure to say, "Have a fun night girls!"....yeah thanks LOL

My usual Italian place when I'm in the Vegas area, and not necessarily because they are extremely good....they are just conveniently located in the Millenium Mile shops.  So...it's easy to find.

I've dined here on numerous occassions, so obviously their food is above average, but I have definitely tasted better.

I would recommend though their fried calamari and their taglieri anitpasto.  The calamari is nice and soft (not chewy) and the selections of meats and cheeses that come on the taglieri (I do hope I'm spelling that right) is pretty tasty.

What I definitely would come back for though, is their vinaigrette ice cream.  And honestly, for the life of me I can't remember what it's really called, but when you look at the menu, you'll know.  Such an interesting taste and flavor...it initially sounds weird. But, I would come back for this.
Just ate here. Don't do it. Microwave in use frozen everything. The staff is great. Eat here is you want Denny'sat a outback price tag.

We were looking for somewhere to eat that was reasonably priced (especially in Vegas), casual, and tasty. We found ourselves at Lombardi's at Planet Hollywood in the Miracle Mile Shops. 

We ate on the "patio" which was not outside but in the outdoor-looking area in the mall. We had a nice view of the fountain, and the people walking by weren't too much of a distraction. The service started out a little grumpy, but was extremely attentive. The waiter actually was watching his tables and noticed when anyone needed something or a plate cleared. 

The food was also good. I had some of the best gnocchi I've had In a long time. Not overly heavy like some are and In a tasty sauce. 

Overall I would recommend Lombardi's as a good place to go for some reasonablly priced Italian dishes. The shops there are also fun to walk around.

I have come to this restaurant several times over the past years while visiting Vegas. Consistently good food. Always get an outdoor table(well outside of the restaurant on their patio looking out towards the variety show entrance and water display, but your really indoors) They start you off with warm bread to dip in a plate of olive oil, parmesan cheese and balsamic vinegar. Perfect combination with the bread. The bread is hard on the outside and soft on the inside...delicious.  this time, I ordered the rigatoni dish (with mushrooms and pancetta) and my friend ordered the lasagna. He felt it was small but good. Check out the pic. I thought it was a good portion. I also had the pinot grigio (the first on the list, I forget the name). It was light and not sweet and paired well with my rigatoni. The rigatoni was cooked all dented. Yum yum yum! If your song at the miracle mile shops or need a bite before a show, this is a great choice. Enjoy!
Tasted like little kid food. The fettucine alfredo and rigatoni pomodor had no flavor, needed salt, and pasta was more than al dente. Ive had better everywhere else.
Great atmosphere, great drinks, and great food! I'd give them five stars but our server wasn't quite on the ball. Will definitely go again. The best gnocchi I've ever had!!!

Is it just me or are a lot of the restaurants on the Miracle Mile strip really mediocre and overpriced? My friends decided to eat here for lunch and when they told me where it was my expectations dropped quite a bit.

Starting off we you this sort of flat bread that was cooked kind of like a pizza. They provided the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, and parmesan cheese to dip it in. Unfortunately I found this to be the vest part of the meal.

I ordered the Paglia e Fieno which our server said was one of his favorite pasta dishes here. For about $18.50, what came out was pasta that felt like it had been cooked past al dente, to the point of being too soft, that was drenched in a cream sauce. The sauce itself lacked flavor and depth, it felt like just a bunch of watered down cream covering a bowl of soggy pasta.

This place isn't for me and at it's price point I feel I could find better elsewhere on the strip.

Overpriced...mediocre....bad dry chewy bread..nice waiter...entree over cooked...Spagetti sauce bland and over salted...chicken in pasta chewy... Like 4 mushrooms and 4 peas in vodka sauce..$10 Caesar had 2 croutons...everything ala carte...Bruschetta mushy and tasteless :( very disappointing! Didn't complain during meal..didn't want to upset other guests..ice tea no ice! 1 glass of house wine $10!!!!

The food was delicious!! I didn't think it was too expensive. I paid $40 for a frutti de mare (spell check? Lol) and a sangria. Considering it's Vegas, that's a pretty good price. The service was good too. Our waiter was very nice and attentive.

It is located inside planet Hollywood by their theater. The only thing I thought was weird was that they have a service charge. There were 5 of us and they charged $26 service charge on top of the taxes. Apparently we were considered a big group? Idk but whatever it was:, we paid it lol 

I would come here again! The calzone and spaghetti were amazing! I can only imagine the rest of the food!

Went with a group of twelve and had a very good experience.  The service was great and the food was good.  The server suggested an appetizer sampler plate for the group.  The plate was a great idea and the was plenty of food for everyone.  The entrees were good.  The menu had good variety.

Pros:
Service - we had a very attentive waiter that was knowledgeable, made good suggestions, was friendly and talkative without being overbearing.  Had an issue with the chicken (see below) and it was taken off the bill immediately without a second thought.
Atmosphere - Sure, the fake sky is a little cheesy, but it's fun and the "outdoor" seating area was cute and even with people passing by it wasn't loud.
Roasted Tomato Soup - Oh my god.  It was delicious!! Not sure if it's a standard, because it was the soup of the day but they possibly offer it often?  HIGHLY recommend getting it.
Price - For what you get, I would expect it to be much higher.  $10-$15 for pasta dishes, they also offered more expensive surft and turf, filet mignon, etc for a higher price but this is definitely an affordable non-chain  (I think) option when in Vegas.
Dipping oil for bread: Oh wow...I can't remember exactly but I think it was olive oil, balsalmic vinegar, parmesean cheese, chili pepper flakes, pepper and something else that they mixed together to dip the bread in...it was definitely the best standard olive oil/vinegar type mix that I've ever had at a restaurant. 

Con:
Chicken - my friend and I each had chicken in our pasta (she had added it, didn't come in her dish originally) and we both thought that it tasted like cleaning supplies.  The server talked to the chef about it who suggested that maybe it was the rosemary maridnade that was used.  I'm not sure about that because I like rosemary...suprisingly, even though the chicken was disgusting I am still giving Lombardi's 4 stars because the chicken was taken off the bill, the waiter was super nice about it and the service, other food and atmosphere made up for it.

Although the food here was pretty tasty, the service was very iffy. I think there might just not be enough staff, but I felt especially underserved as compared to those who walked in before and after us. 

When we arrived, there was no one at the host stand, and we had to wait a couple minutes for him. And although he took our drink order, we waited a long time to recieve them, and even longer for him to take our orders. 
We got the oil for our bread early, but the bread itself wasn't given until moments before we finally received our food. Everyone around us, even those that arrived after us, had already received their bread. 

The only complaint I have about the quality of the food is that the alfredo is nothing like any other alfredo sauce I've had before. It's almost transparent, thin, and greenish. It was just okay, but not at all what we expected. 

The decor here is a very bland italian feel. Just whatever. 

I just felt, overall, that I could have had better service and atmosphere with the same quality of food at a less expensive italian joint.

I. I actually went there two nights in  row because the first night was that good!

The first time we went was to see a show at the V theatre which is just across from this restaurant and we wanted to also people watch in the "outside" area. It was for late lunch/early dinner and the place was not busy. Johnny gave us great service and we both ordered fish dishes (halibut and salmon) which were perfectly done as well as the vegetables that came with them. We also ordered the melt in your mouth calamari which was only lightly breaded ( instead of drowned in a bready crust  like some places that do not know how to make this dish) and crisped just right! The manager of the day, Daniel Martinez, also stopped by to  ask if everything was ok- YES!

So, when we decided to go back the next day - because we received some tickets for a free show at the V theatre with dinner..........well that experience other dinners have documented below.

So I found out why some people really like this restaurant - and others don't.

If you are a regular customer, who pays for your meal, you are much more likely to be pleased with your experience here than if you have the "freebie" coupon.

2.  I would go again- but not with the coupon.
Ordered the halibut and it was phenomenal. Even though the venue is inside I really like the "outdoor seating". Food was very quick. I would definitely come back.

Great little find hidden away within the bowels of planet Hollywood. We were looking for something to eat that we couldn't find at our own local strip malls, and we didn't want to pay $40 for a meal just cause it was in Vegas.

This place had it all... "outdoor" seating, under the bright blue sky with scattered puffy clouds (all of course painted in the high domed ceilings), quality food at a normal price for what you get, and friendly service.  

The pasta was well cooked, the meat was tender and juicy, and the sauces full of flavor.  The gnocchi melts in your mouth, and the shrimp was perfectly cooked, which is hard to find in the middle of the dessert.

This is a typical sit-down restaurant with cloth napkins and home-made bread served with oil and vinegar and entrees ranging from teens to tens of dollars. Everything from steak to veal to salmon was available and there was even a lobster ravioli on the menu.  

I'll definitely be eating here again.

Superb restaurant.  Friendly bartender drew pours honest drinks while suppli al Telefono (3 fried risotto balls filled with fontini cheese) would have been enough with the excellent bread and dipping sauce but then I would have missed the house made pasta in the taglioni scampi (shrimp with capers in wine sauce). Reasonable prices for Vegas.

Food was very good here. Pizza was amazing.  Bruschetta was good.  Fettucini was good.  Service was great until after the meal. I asked for the check and it was 20 minutes before we saw the waiter within 20 feet of our table again. 

If there's one "don't" it's don't make your table wait on their check.

Not so great that I'll put it on my return list for vegas, simply because I'm not here that often and there are so many other places to try.

Worst margarita I've ever had. Worst fettuccine Alfredo I've ever had. Caesar salad was subpar. Bread was okay. 

Our server was nice, and that's about the only good thing I have to say about this place. Do NOT eat here if you can avoid it. Ugh.

I can't say their main courses are excellent. But they're pretty good. The main thing I enjoy there is their gluten free pasta - it's just as good as regular pasta, even better my friend insists.

Service was excellent, we were seated promptly, and the ambiance is nice. Try to sit outside the restaurant inside the Miracle Mile shops... Great to people watch.

Ask for Alvaro as your server if you can. He gave us superior service, very attentive, and friendly.

Had dinner here the other night before a show the service was excellent. We had the Beef Carpaccio, daily specials chicken and Fettuccine and Pescatore with lobster tail. Finished with cheese cake and Créme Brulee all very good.

The food was excellent. Our waitress Mega was exceptional. My husband and I selected the Show menu because we got two free dinner tickets with the Motown Revue show. I had the chicken Marsala and my husband had the pan-seared tilapia. It was all delicious. Our server Megan was awesome! She was very knowledgeable and helped us to make a good choice for dinner. We would definitely go back here for dinner whenever we're back in Vegas.

There are so many dining options in Vegas and this restaurant stumbled upon us as we were frantically looking for a place to eat that didn't have a 45 minute wait or cost an arm and a leg. To sum up our experience, it was neither a good or bad experience. We were told there was no wait but then ended up waiting for about 7 minutes talking to the manager (maybe owner) at the front because he wanted to give his waitress "time to catch up". Uhm, how about staffing correctly and seating accordingly. But things like this happen so it wasn't a huge deal. 

Sat down at the table only to find out that the waitress was definitely not caught up by any means. The number one factor in knowing that a server is busy is when your bar drinks are brought out before sodas, tea, waters, etc by another server simply running well drinks. 10 minutes in, we had all of our drinks and were ready to order. 

I ordered the caprese salad and one of the items off their daily specials: Lobster Ravioli. The Caprese Salad did not disappoint but it is hard to mess that up. The Lobster Ravioli was a huge disappointment. It was OK, but tasted almost as if it was frozen. Small portions, so I would suggest ordering at least 2 courses whenever dining here. 

All in all, the service kinda sucked and the food didn't necessarily make up for it so hence the "eh" 3 star review. It is not a restaurant I would overlook going to in the future, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here next time I am in Vegas.

The atmosphere was excellent, smooth jazz playing in a contemporary italian theme. Service was great. Very attentive waitor and the plates were removed from the table as soon as your done eating.

Had pan seared  halibut with roasted asparagus and mashed potatoes. The halibut was over cooked but the asparagus was cooked perfectly. The white wine  butter sauce with lemon  confit was absolutely amazing. Drizzled over the mashed potatoes was a necessary complement. And great ice tea.

Definitely  will eat here again tho. 

As far as price. Not bad 25 bucks a plate!

Located in PH's mall.  

We went for brunch and were seated right away.  Service was good.  Food was decent.
Breakfast was decent for the price. $1 refills on the mimosas: YES. Server was great, gave me a huge to-go cup full of mimosa and was very attentive. Will definitely go back next time I'm in town.

So bland and basically terrible food. I'm Italian and I can't believe they dare call this Italian food. There's no garlic in anything and they only used dry herbs! 

Don't you dare go here if you've ever been to a good Italian place, you will be very disappointed.

Love this restaurant! Everything is always wonderful. Come here anytime I come to town from Texas. The food is amazing & the service is outstanding. Only get to come about once a year but it's always worth the wait. Anniversary date & a dessert on the house, got 2 & shared! We get the Chef's Focaccia & love that, you can watch them cook it in the pizza oven. Can't miss the lasagna, the bechamel sauce is out of this world. My hubby loves to get the rib-eye with a salad, so tender. Chocolate cake was my favorite!
Very pleasanly surprised at the quality of food here.  Great service from the bartender as we were sitting at the bar for dinner.  Risotto was excellent.

Not bad but not great either.  With so many great restaurants in Vegas skip this one and go somewhere better.  Portion were on the small side and a little pricey considering the quality of ingredients used.
Great Italian food reasonably priced on the strip.  Had a nice Chianti with gluten free pasta.  Sauce was flavorful and service was great!!  Great stop for dinner before a show at the V theater.

Amazingly good. We went for the pre fixed theatre menu as a result of a free package we received.

The food and service was very good. Jose our waiter was professional and very attentive. Since this was a freebee I was expecting the worst. 

Was I wrong. The salad and my rigatoni in a meat sauce was exceptional. My wife enjoyed her Alfredo. 

The dessert was to die for.

Will return next time in Vegas

OMG....this is our new favorite place to eat in Vegas and we come here a lot!  From Brad the host to Johnny our server and the chef that cook our food, this is def a 5 STAR restaurant!  We all had a different meal so we could taste each other's food and it was DELISH!    I can't remember the meal  names but it's all good!  Thank you guys for making up for the nightmarish restaurants we've had to endure since we arrived two days ago!
Very good service, portions were small though. We both had the chicken Marsala with mashed potatoes and vegetables. It was decent. Not a bad pllace

Who knew the super touristy Miracle Mile could have such a wonderful Italian restaurant??? 

The Happy Hour sign lured me in...the staff took excellent care of me, (a party of 1), on an extremely busy evening. 

The wine was SPOT ON and the Lobster Ravioli dinner was fabulous! I really enjoyed the olive oil/parmesan cheese/ balsamic vinegar bread dip! 


Highly recommend! 

Fair prices too! (Golden in Vegas!)

I wouldn't even give this restaurant a star. We went there mar27 party of ten. I ordered the fettuccine with seafood after I had dinner i went straight to the bathroom. Food hit me so hard i had to stay home until the next day for diarrhea. Today mar29 i am now in the hospital for abdominal pain. I asked the people that was with me that night, i found out that the other 2 also had diarrhea. I called the restaurant to tell them what happened of course they are on a defensive mode he said 200 other customers did not complain. Guess what 2 of my friends did not complain as well. I told them to please make sure their seafood is handled well because it is prone to be spoiled if not handled right

Came here for a really late dinner with a friend. As in 11pm.  They said they were closed but somehow my friend talked them into letting us in.

I had the seafood risotto and an Italian margarita.  The food here is nice enough.  Nothing special compared to a lot of places on the strip but it's not a celebrity restaurant. It's a good mid-priced option on the strip. 

I'm bumping this up a star for the hostess who went out of her way to let us in so late. Thank you!

My wife and I had dinner here before the Zombie Burlesque show. We both had the Chopped Salad with Salmon. Honestly, one of the best salads we've ever had! Fresh ingredients and a large, perfectly cooked salmon filet. Plus our waitress, Amanda, was fantastic! Great food and great service! We'll be back!

After a late night of partying...my girlfriends and I roamed the Miracle Mile Shops and stumbled on this place for brunch.  We actually saw a sign to another restaurant and decided to try the place once we saw the sign for unlimited mimosas.

We were promptly seated and our waiter came to us right away to take our mimosa orders.  Now...we were given the choice of mimosas or bellinis and we were allowed to mix.  Boy...was I feeling good when I left this place.

Anyhow, onto my brunch.  I have a slight obsession with Lox and Bagels ( with extra capers) and this place DID NOT disappoint.  Everything was super fresh and I really enjoyed it.  Yes, it's as good as the Lox and Bagels that you get in NYC.

My girlfriends each got an omelet and loved their meals too.

The food and drink here are definitely worth it!

This is one of those hidden lil' spots within the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. I thought the food was pretty darn good. I think it fits high above an Olive Garden/chain-type Italian place, but not as good as the more refined Italian joints like some of the Batali or other big-name ones. 

I was surprised to see such low reviews for this place, but then I noticed a lot of people were reviewing breakfast. I don't know about you, but when I think about where to go to breakfast in Vegas, an Italian restaurant is not my first thought or choice. I'm just sayin'... 

Anyhow, we split two different pasta dishes and really liked them both. The bread in the beginning was delish with the wonderful oil. I wish we had room for dessert since I love tiramisu. Next time... 

I think this place is undervalued for the better-than-average/not-as-good-as-the-greats section of Vegas dining. I would stop by if you're in the area and looking for a bite to eat - especially since the dining options in PH (excluding the MM shops) are minimal compared to other casinos. Check it out and eat some tiramisu for me!

Searching through the desert heat for something that was NOT a buffet and NOT some hokey "theme" restaurant, my fellow traveler and I found Lombardi's. It turned out to be the most satisfying meal of our trip.

The place is classic italian and decorated as such. It feels very comfortable, just like my mom's house! (take my word, her place is comfy) Anyway, the ambiance is great, and it is not overly fancy or anything like that. Very casual. 

Our waiter, Evan (I believe that was his name), was AWESOME. Very friendly and knew exactly when to swing by the table and check on us. He made some great suggestions for food choices, and he would come to the table and refill not only our water, but also our sodas, when he saw they were depleting. THAT is good service. He was very personable, adding to the comfortable, homey ambiance.

The food was also great; everything tasted delicious and was well-prepared. We had some stuffed shrimp appetizer, and the shrimp were HUGE. We also had bruschetta. I had a salmon dish, broiled w/ veggies. Again, EVERYTHING was delicious, and while my memory is horrible and I can't remember what my friend ate, I did try it and remember it being delicious as well. Lasagna, maybe? 

Lombardi's is located in the Planet Hollywood resort, formerly Aladdin. It might be on the Miracle Mile shops part of it. Kind of a shame that people walking by outside the resort would never know Lombardi's is in there, as they'd be missing out on a great meal and great service!

Good eats! Great place to go eat before or after the show at the V theater.  The pre-meal bread is like a mini meal. Ordered the fish with sauce on the side. Service was a bit rushed, waiter was all about the upsell, and just like everything else in Vegas he was zombie-like

Amazing food. We had got a voucher from a timeshare. I got the chicken my husband got the tilapia. My kids got the childrens pizza. Everything was amazing. The house bread, cesar salad too. We had a wonderful waitress. I think her name was jessica. (Im bad with names) she explained to me how the vouchers worked. She was very helpful, polite and pretty. I would come to this place next time in in vegas.

My boyfriend and I were on the strip and looking for a good people watching spot. This place was perfect! It's located inside Planet Hollywood and is right by the theatre. Great for watching people line up and walk by. 

The food was overall very good too. We had the beef carpaccio as an app which was good but I haven't crazy about the texture. The complimentary bread and oil was great, very fresh. As an entree I had the lobster salad which was plenty then enough food. The lobster was super fresh and I loved the light citrus dressing. My boyfriend had a truffle type pasta which the server suggested. I can't remember the name and would not even want to try to spell it, but anyways I tried it and it was very good as well. The flavors were delicious and not over powering.

Overall this was a very nice place. I'd recommend it for a romantic strip date night. The server also said all of the pastas and desserts were made fresh in house which is always great to hear.
Amazing pizza. Great for brunch! Bottomless mimosas and steak and eggs. Yum

The quality of the food and the flavor is definitely there. The portions, however, are very small. For example, I ordered a Caesar salad before my meal, and it came out on a small plate instead of a bowl. I paid $10 for a about 5 bites of salad. It tasted good, but I was hungry. I then had some ravioli. Delish! But again, I got about 6-7 raviolis on a regular sized dish-$18. I spent about $30 on myself alone and left hungry.

One of my "must go"
Places every time I'm in Vegas- 4 or 5 times a year. It's perfect to be away for the noise of a casino restaurant. Lombardi's is in Miracle Mile mall close to Planet Hollywood and Elara. 
   Eat at the bar and ask for Joel or Omar. Great happy hour drink specials. 

Love the Lobster ravioli.

I was truly impressed with this restaurant, the service is just amazing! Every single individual worked very good on teams to try to provide the customers with a great experience. The food was also very good. I personally do not like too much marinara sauce and in this case the lasagna had just the right amount of sauce. I liked the fact that this allowed me to taste other flavors besides the sauce. We also had the shrimp scampi as an appetizer which was good as well. You get four jumbo shrimp with a delicious sauce on it! I would probably  recommend it. For our dessert we ordered the chocolate cake!!! I'm truly a sucker for melting chocolate and this was not an exception.  The cake was so soft and so filled with warm chocolate!!!!! It was delish! 
Overall, excellent customer with good food.

On our most recent trip to vegas BF and I decided to try Lombardi's for our last dinner in town. The greek salad I had was excellent. Sometimes when you order a salad in a nice restaurant the price is way too much for a salad that is sooo not worth it. I was really happy to see that I didn't just get a trough of romaine with some hot chicken tossed on top wilting the lettuce, lol. I had fresh greens, yummy chicken, and some delicious feta. Very nicely presented, too! 

Boyfriend's risoto was pretty good, I thought. I'd never tried risoto but I thought it was tasty. He just said it was pretty decent, but keep in mind he's gone to culinary school and is a bit of a food snob. 

Service was excellent (food came out quickly and refills were handled in a timely manner as well).  I liked that even grown ups get crayons to draw on the paper tablecloth. 

The price wasn't too bad, honestly. I live in Orange County here in CA and it's nothing worse than you'd pay around here for a nice meal. Dinner for two and a nice tip for the waiter came out to $50.

The reason I took off a star is their manager. The table next to us had a big dramafest over a customer service issue, and the manager was a total douche to them. Even our waiter admitted that he was embarrassed of the manager. I was mortified *for* him because it was awful, not to mention a little uncomfortable for the tables within earshot.
Good service, great ambiance, overpriced and mediocre food.  If there was an Olive Garden in the Miracle Mile Shops, I'd prefer to go there instead.

Lombardi's is a gem located deep in the PH mall across from Stripper Bar. We rarely go out for Italian food (being from NYC) but we thought we would give this place a try, since we read the menu online and saw they had GLUTEN FREE offerings!! I am insulin sensitive, so I do not eat gluten by choice. It makes me feel sick. Anyway, this is the first time I have seen GF in a restaurant. We were seated right away )we had an 8pm reservation), and declined the bread basket. I had an appetizer of zuppa de mussels and clams and they were the best I have tasted. For my entree, I had fruita de mar (which is more seafood on pasta, with a red sauce). My fiancee had an alfredo dish with GF pasta. All the food was delicious, although next time, I will try and order a bigger portion of my appetizer over GF pasta, because it was much, much better than the entree. It had more garlic and a stronger flavor. Great service. Would recommend. PS you can color on the tableclothes as you wait for your food. They give you crayons and all. lol

Pretty good. The pizza was kinda bready, edible not great. I had a hearty breakfast here. It was a shrimp and asparagus omlette with hollandaise sauce, which made the eggs mushy and kind of gross, I would not recommend this combination of food. Came with some potatoe and 

 Service was super excellent and nice, and I liked the coffee.

I was told by my mother was visiting me in Las Vegas that they had found a great Italian restaurant and for my birthday I was going to see Britney Spears concert right across the way so my husband and I spent about an hour and a half at the bar and everything that we ordered which was calamari and two other appetizers I'm not completely sure but we also ordered a tear in the Sue and after we left my husband said I really liked that place I said so did I
I've been eating Italian food on my life and cooking it and I'm very hit or miss want to comes to Italian food cooked right but the portions were nice for appetizers and we ordered percent go and I believe my husband had whiskey while he gambled I think he started with whiskey at this restaurant
Other than that I'm not too sure that many people know about this place because it's not very promoted heavily in Las Vegas but I know that every time my parents come they always want to go there

Food mediocre.  Had the veal, tough as shoe leather.  Sauce was good.  My friend had a shrimp and pasta dish that was good.  Felt they were dishonest.  The waiter said he was going to bring us some bread, then he asked, 'garlic bread or regular'.  I asked for garlic, not knowing that they were going to charge me $10 for garlic bread.  The waiter made it sound like it was regular complementary bread served at almost every Italian place I ever ate.  
Service was also slow.  Would not ever go back.  Very, very expensive for so-so food.
Horrible service. Soup was burned. How do you burn soup? And the tomatoes for the bruschetta were old and limp. Very bad.

Stopped by just for dessert and drinks late on Saturday night.  We had hunted down a good tiramisu and came here.  Ordered the tiramisu and a couple of sangria. Tiramisu was A+ and while the sangria itself was good, it was served in a wine glass, filled to the top with ice, then a very small amount of sangria.   Not how it is normally served which kind of ruined it for us.

My daughter and I stoped there after a long day and wanted a nice sit down meal. Probably the best meal we've had in Vegas. A pizza will serve 2. We had a pasta dish and pizza and shared back and forth. The bottled iced teas are worth the charge and save room for dessert. My daughter had cheesecake and I had tiramisu. OMG is what I say to that dessert.

This place is one of the worst place for breakfast. I ordered my breakfast and I had to pay for bread and ask couple of time to refill my coffee.  I wouldn't recommend it at all. FYI the food portion is too small.

I had dinner here late at night (10 pm). Our entrees (the gnocchi and the fiochi) were fantastic. But service was slow and portions were shockingly small for how much it cost. And the bread they put on your table is pretty blah; looked like it was just sliced from a grocery store loaf. We had the panna cotta for dessert, which was tasty but tiny (and it was $8 to boot).

They have an entire gluten free menu!!! 

We ordered (all gluten free) the chef's focaccia, the Capelli D'Angelo pasta, and a pepperoni pizza and it was all delicious! This was among the best gluten free Italian food I have ever had. The portions are very large...we were both stuffed and had food left over.

The staff is great! The hostess was very friendly and our server was fabulous! I highly recommend Lombardi's for all of my gluten challenged comrades...you will not be sorry.

If I could leave no stars I would. Food sucks and our server was mute. Food was extremely plain with little flavor. Sloppy presentation as well. One of our party members did not enjoy their food and the server replied with "okay" and took their dish. Avoid this place at all costs and save your money.

This place is conveniently located in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood and was really the only restaurant that caught our attention walking through the shops (minus Strip House found across the way from this place).  

Thumbs up for the perfectly cooked salmon and veggies I ordered.  Our friend's pasta dish, however, was a bit under seasoned (which worked out perfectly for her).  If it weren't for the endless amount of restaurants on the strip, I'd come back and have the same thing.  

Service was okay.  Our waiter was very unamused by our slight belligerence, which is understandable, but at the same measure, uncalled for considering it was a late Vegas evening.

I came here to eat for lunch on NYE. It is located inside Planet Hollywood near the Miracle Mile shops and other restaurants. It is a basic italian restaurant. I ordered the California Pizza, which was not that great to me. But my friends all said they enjoyed their pasta. They sat us on the outside, so I guess its great for people watching. The waitress seemed a little slow when taking care of our bill and she made a mistake but it worked out fine in the end. Oh and they have crayons on the table so that you can draw on the table paper.

So, I came in and asked for their best drink. I was trying to be super friendly with the bar tender to give me his best shot. Terribly disappointed! I was served a pomegranate martini... Awfully sweet, very generic and completely forgettable. I asked him again for his opinion on the appetizer.. And order the Lombardi's focaccia.. Now, when you know the name sake dish is not good, this is NOT going to be good! This was an oversized appetizer for a bread, and was very dry and ordinary. I mean so ordinary, I could've gotten better room service had I stayed up in my room. Then, the chef or the owner came up to me and personally recommended the daily special salmon on a bed of cous cous. Oh god!!! The disaster, the fish was dry and over cooked, dressed in unnecessarily large garnish and the cous cous... How do I talk about how bad the cous cous was without a tear in my eye. Lumpy, overcooked, not-fluffy and flavorless. There, I found almost all the right words to describe it. Overall, my experience at this restaurant was a nightmare. Never to return again! Au revoir Lombardi's!!

Personally, this is a nice date spot. It's reasonably priced for the amount of food you get. 

The food and table service is pretty fast. 

The food quality is relatively fresh and the pasta is good! 

I would not recommend the Beef Carpaccio because it was not very flavorful. Instead, get the Bruschetta or calamari.

Tip: inside seating is a lot more romantic and intimate. Outside can be very busy and distracting. Either way, you'll have a good time.

Shout out to Joel, the bartender! 

(Pictured: Beef Carpaccio & Gnocchi)

I gave this place a few stars because the atmosphere was pleasant and the server was good, but the food was not good. My chicken tasted a bit dry and blah, like it was reheated in a microwave too long. My girlfriend was not fond of her meal either. Too much money for what you get.

The food was just okay- I had the Paglia e Fieno and it didn't hold a candle to other tagliolini dishes that I've had at other Italian restaurants. The chicken was a bit dry and there were way too many mushrooms in my dish for my liking. From the look of their wine menu, I see they have a much larger variety of red wines than they do on white wines. There was only one listing for Riesling so I went ahead and ordered the Bellini Classico.

While eating an elderly man walked up to our table playing the violin and tried his bets to lay Lionel Richie's  "Hello" (one of my favorites) but he forgot the words and after an abrupt stop he says "thank you, thank you. I work for tips". My bf hands him a $20 and asks for change back and they guy throws down singles over our food as if he didn't see it there. 

Then we have the picture lady that shows up to take our picture for "free" and give us a discounted offer on the pictures and a 20% discount if we returned. 

There was way to much money grumbling going on during our dinner! Not a fan of being harassed while I eat my dinner.

My daughter and I took the tram and walked here from the Mandalay Bay. We chose this place cause we couldn't go any further, lol. 

I don't really like pasta, especially 9 pm @ night but I ordered the bolognese because they were made with homemade noodles. My daughter ordered the spaghetti with meatballs. 

Our server was very nice (she kind of looked like Celine Dion) and the food came out extremely fast (only a few minutes later). The food was just okay, the bread with olive oil, balsamic, and parmesan was just okay, too. The portions are also a little small. And a little pricey as well for what it is.

I wish I would have planned a little more and @ least go to Spago's or something better and had more memorable food, especially in Vegas :0
Our first time here. We had a company dinner, the service was amazing, the food was excellent & it was a great experience.

Amazing food!!! 

We got the Caesar salad and the gnocchi. Both were fantastic. The sauce was homemade and to die for! They brought us out complimentary cheese bread and olive oil and balsamic vinegar with Parmesan cheese as an appetizer. 

Our server was very nice and attentive. I highly recommend this place if you want good Italian that's reasonably priced!

I love this place! 

I had their gluten free pasta and pizza. It was to die for. Usually after you eat pasta you will feel so stuffed, however after eating here I didn't feel "heavy" at all, which was pleasant :) Their waiters are so nice and friendly. This place is located inside the Miracle Mall where Planet Hollywood is, so it is a great place to stop by while you are shopping!

Lombardi's was one of the restaurants on the list from a voucher I received from attending timeshare.  We got to choose from a limited menu of 4 items of steak, fish, pasta or chicken with a side of mashed potatoes and vegetables.  It also access to the buffet soup and salad bar towards the rear of the restaurant.  Food and service was awesome.  

However they charge a "Water conservation fee" of $1 per person.

My husband and I had been to this restaurant for lunch in May.  We just returned from a trip to the Marriott Grand Chateau for my husband's Birthday.  We decided to spend lunch on his Birthday and tried this restaurant once again.  Needless to see we regretted the choice.  Our last visit was so classy, from the man in a suit greeting us, to the waiter who was incredible and thorough.  This time we were given Sara, I told her it was my husbands Birthday and he would join me in a few minutes, she said well are you going to order dessert.  I had no idea but just for the sake of his Birthday she would have made some sort of effort.  She instead said oh I will be around the corner holler when he arrives.  The pizza was greasy and not up to par. My husband had a chicken dish which was good enough but not what we had been accustomed to before.  Such a gorgeous décor, but it all depends on the waiter, waitress and Sara could care less about customer service.  We will not be returning and regret that on  his 71st Birthday we didn't choose another venue.  Perhaps the manager should think about why there were only a total of five guests for lunch that day.

I don't like when people tell me to recommend something delicious, but fast and I don't know what the group wants to eat. Everything I know is a drive away so it's not quite "fast" for starving tourist. Family in town just decided to walk around their hotel and settled on this. 

I used to work in the PH and though this isn't the best Italian for the price, it wasn't a bad option. We were here and some people needed food, now. 

The table shared:

Scampi Picatta ($10.50) - I didn't care if there wasnt shrimp, I more wanted the sauce to dip bread in.
Caprese ($11)- the elements were fresh, but I think that they really shouldn't substitute basil oil for real basil. Basil makes a big part of it. 

I got the paglia e fieno ($16.50) for my entree. The creamy truffle oil sauce went well with pasta, but the chicken wasn't necessary. It was flavorless and didn't help elevate the dish. I would have been happier with more mushrooms. I've had this a long time ago when I worked in the PH and I remember it being better then. Hrrm...

I took a bite of Pork Ossobuco ($21.50) my sister was having which was pretty good, and the pizzas (Pizza al Prosciutto, Pizza al Salamino Piccante) the rest of the family was munching on was just A-OK. One brother had Risotto Fruiti Di Mare ($18.50), I didn't try it but if my foodie brother didn't comment on food he's eating that means "it will do".

If you need food- its a decent option. However, I rather try to convince visitors to go off strip for better Italian for this price.
Quite good Italian cuisine. We sampled the lobster ravioli and the seafood diavolo and both were tasty. Service was likewise and I'd return again if in the area.

A-OK is what this place is! I came here before the J.LO concert with friends and it seemed to be a reasonable restaurant to check out but the service was pretty crappy.

Our waitress started out A-OK but then as the night progressed and we asked questions she didn't seem too knowledgeable or helpful. I asked what their Wi-Fi password was and her answer was "I don't know", and didn't even offer to find out until I asked her.

My friend wanted to order a certain drink and the waitress made a comment saying it wasn't that good and she wouldn't recommend it. Despite what she thinks of the drink she shouldn't be putting her two cents in. I also seem to recall when we placed our orders for lasagna she seemed hesitant about that as well as if it wasn't a good choice. Maybe she was right since there was hardly any meat in the lasagna. Regardless her whole demeanor was not pleasant!

I will say that she was kind enough to surprise me with a birthday treat that was unexpected so I thank her for that, even though it wasn't that great. The cookie or shell was hard as a rock and kept flying everywhere when I tried to dive into it with my spoon. The chocolate filling was a little too rich for me and I couldn't finish it.

I ordered a margarita on the rocks, no salt and talk about a very weak margarita! It didn't taste like there was any alcohol in it. For $10 this was a very poorly made drink! Don't waste your money. The lemon drop on the other hand was pretty good.

I think I mostly enjoyed the Caesar salad, bread and dipping sauce. The lasagna was pretty good as well but again it was lacking meat.

Overall this place is overpriced and the food/drinks is mediocre. Could this be the reason why our waitress was trying to talk us out of ordering certain items on the menu? Maybe so.

Italian is one of my favorites. Give me that and mexican and I'll be a happy girl. We went here as a group of 6 before heading out for the night. I had the chicken alfredo. It was, just okay. I've had better. I ordered some sort of mule to drink and the guy brought me a mojito. I know they are kind of similar, but it wasn't very good. Couldn't even finish it. It wasn't very crowded, but we did go kinda late, around 9:30-10pm. My friends got the pizza and I had a little bit of FOMO... not gonna lie! Not sure if I'd return. I'd probably search for a different Italian place next time.

this is how it goes... 

6 people still hung over from the night before walk all around the casino mall to find a place to sit and eat. 

"this place looks good" "okay sure why the hell not"

the group gets seated relatively promptly. everyone gets menus and decide on what to order. ... one says "ooo look at this.. 'bottomless mimosas' sounds good huh?" ... waitress comes over.. "well actually, its not BOTTOMLESS we will cut you off so dont think you can keep drinking all day and you HAVE to order off the brunch menu or its not".... fine bloody mary it is.. orders are taken. 

salad and bruschetta come. both just blah. nothing too special about generic food. 40 mins later after the starters are done... the groups starts to look around.. there are 6 empty glasses of water, an empty salad plate and empty bruschetta plate... 

waitress comes to pick up the plates and says.. "so i can put your order in now? cuz thats how we do it here, we dont fire up the food until you are done with the food... sorry thats how we do it here its going to be a quick min while i tell the kitchen to start your food" .... the group looks around as 4 other tables seated after them have ordered, ate and are leaving... 

30 mins later.. the food still hasnt arrived.. she comes back.."drinks all around for you all sorry about the misunderstanding about the food coming out after the starters" ..fuck it mimosas all around then. ... 

egg beni-sucked. not enough hollandaise sauce. and dont go with the crab..its a bit fishy... 
waffle- was decent. nothing to write home about. 
shrimp scampi-you have better chances of getting authentic stuff at olive garden... 

overall.. the food and service was not good. and that my friends is coming from people who are hung over.. usually tired people just need filled water glasses and bread on the table. . .

I attended a wedding and the reception dinner was held at Lombardi's. We had a choice of lasagna, fettuccini alfredo, or chicken parm. All three entrees were disappointing, bland, and the pasta was overcooked.  The chicken cutlet in the parm was rubbery and dry. Later, we learned that the Italian chef was out that day.

The only good thing we were served that evening was the antipasta. Maybe you'll have a better meal if you go on a day where the main chef is in, but with so many dining options in LV, why bother?

We were staying at the Aria and were looking for a good Italian restaurant, so I looked it up on yelp and Lombardi's popped up. It has good reviews and we weren't feeling too picky, so we walked over. We get there and immediately get sat. I was really excited because it was my birthday, and the menu sounded amazing. The downside was, our server couldn't find the time to even greet us. We sat for about 10 minutes when we finally had to wave someone down. He then walked over seeming a little irritated, and just stood there holding his book and a pen staring at us like we were supposed to read his mind. We understood at first because we all have our bad days. So we ordered our drinks and food all together and told him to just bring everything as it comes. We were trying to be easy. Our cocktails took longer than expected, then after looking around and seeing maybe 5 other tables than us, realizing they're obviously not busy...what's going on? I saw our drinks sitting on the bar top as our server went around filling waters on tables where there were no people. He slowly made his way to the bar and brought us our drinks. By the time our food came, he didn't ask if we wanted any refills, which we all did...I wanted to order a bottle of wine and he never came back to take our order. The only words he spoke was if we wanted some bread for the table. We said yes. And we got this beautiful flatbread for the center of our table. It was amazing. However, all of our dishes were cold and he forgot that I said I didn't want shrimp, and there was shrimp. We were soooo over it so we asked for the check. Our server ended up having the manager bring the check, which was weird. And it had the almost $20 flatbread appetizer on it...which we never ordered. He just ran that in for us when he asked if we wanted bread. There were also only 5 of us, and there was an 18% gratuity added to it. We were upset. We asked the manager to take the appetizer off and for the gratuity to be taken off. Worst service ever. But the weirder part was he was extremely attentive to the other guests around us. Wtf?! We paid for the bill, and gave the foodrunner a $100 tip instead because she was the only one who even smiled at us and asked if we needed more water. That's all we wanted. Very disappointing because it's a cute restaurant and the menu seemed like it could have been good.

What a delightful surprise! We were given free dinner and show vouchers so we weren't expecting much. I have to say the food was very good. The pan fried Tilapia, the caesar salad, the bread, and especially the Blackberry Mojito was fantastic. What really made the dining experience great was our server Alvaro!! We will definitely be dining at Lombardi's again when we return to Las Vegas!!

At the tail end of the Longest Weekend Ever, three of us stopped in to have an early lunch. We were thrilled to get there just in time for brunch to start, but as it happened we stuck to pasta for the food. We did get to order mimosas, which feature $1 refills during brunch.

I wish I could remember the name of Azya C.'s entree - it was a lunch special, a pasta stuffed with pear & gorgonzola in a white (not alfredo) sauce. The pasta looked like sacchietti but I know they weren't named that. This dish, although sized modestly, was the best-tasting dish we had. I had the gnocchi and even added chicken at the suggestion of our server -- and it was pretty good! We also had the spaghetti & meatballs, which were reportedly "not bad."

Our service was excellent, and we enjoyed sitting "outside" where we could watch the Miracle Mile Shops' patrons pass by. This is definitely a great spot for standard Italian fare and definitely recommended if you're shopping or staying at Planet Hollywood.

This place rocked.  The food is great and we got great service too.  I ordered the fettucini alfredo and L ordered some seafood pasta.  We both loved our dishes.  The waiter seemed maybe a litttle too excited to be serving us and ended up giving us his phone number.  A little awkward, but whatever, he also gave us free focaccia bread and free dessert!

Food: 4 stars
Price: 3 stars
Atmosphere/decor: 2.5 stars

Let me start off with the food. I ordered the lasagna and one more pasta that had mushrooms and chicken in it. Both were delicious and both were portioned enough for my mom and I to be full. BUT i think that with the decor of the place and the price, I'm not sure if I would come back here. First off, who uses yellow table covers? I think that threw me off the most. It was so tacky and ugly looking that really, with the quality of food being produced from this place, if they only made this place look nice(starting with replacing those really really ugly yellow table covers) I'd pay $35 for the two portions of pasta. I know we're in vegas so prices are a bit more expensive, but I think that the setting of a place is just as important as anything else and they need to update their look. If prices were about $2-3 less, maybe the ugly table cloths will do.

OH i also like that the bread came out nice and warm, and this was the first place that i've ever been to where they separate the olive oil from the balsamic vinegar using Parmesan cheese! what a brilliant idea EVERY Italian restaurant must do. I hate picking up mostly oil in my dip, but when its separated, i can have more vinegar and less oil.

We went here as a part of the package we got from V theater for their show. Usually when you go some place that is contracted with a theater the fixed menu and servers aren't that great but that was not the case with this place. The server was very attentive and friendly. The chicken marsala and caesar salad was decent. It was a great experience.

Dinner was great!  We had the blackened tilapia and the chicken Marcella dishes and both were delicious.  The tilapia was very spicy, which i love!  We had the chocolate cake dessert and it was heavenly!  Our service was goodmtoo!

Six of us were in As Vegas this past 
St Patrick's weekend.
We ate at Lombardi's and had the best host and server.
Bradley was our host with the greatest personality ever!
He was so gracious, funny and friendly!
We would love to see more people like him as he seemed to of loved what he was doing!
Our server Sara was great as well!
We would go back to visit them anytime.
Food was good too!
Terry Precious
From Minnesota

Good: 
1. Nice ambiance
2. Quickly seated
3. I like the cesar salad, salmon, chicken marsala, and desserts. 


Bad: 
1. Order the long island $14 it had no alcohol. The size of the cup was cool : ) 
2. The portion of the food is very small. The size of salmon was 1/2 of my palm. That's too small. 
3. Things are way too over price. I don't mine paying at the high end sometimes but at least give me an appropriate portion.

Not bad, but there are certainly other places to eat. Service is good the food is decent. This review is just for breakfast items.  The Benedict is a little bit dry, but I love the fact that they don't overcharge you for crab vs ham.  The best thing about this place is 7 dollar mimosas or bellinis, and 1 dollar refills!!!!!! Plus you can take it in sippy cup Togo!!! My gals and I had about 8 mimosas for 14 dollars, better than a price of one bottle of champagne .... Will certainly come back just for that inside Planet Hollywood.

The bread is great and delicious when you dip it in their herbs/olive oil.

I ordered Paglia e Fieno and it was delicious has wild mushrooms, spinach type pasta.. yum..  i sat across from a dancing watershow to make the meal even more enjoyable.  It is reasonably priced to be off the strip in the Miracle Miles shops.

Really good food Yexica was our waitress and she was wonderful   We shared a salad the balsamic dressing was so good.  
We had the shrimp dish with asparagus and risotto  and chicken with risotto. Both were excellent. We shared a piece of cheesecake. Yummy 
Would definitely come again.

This restaurant is located in the Miracle Mile Shops in Planet Hollywood. The bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was very good. The spaghetti with meatballs was quite tasty. The sauce was good but unfortunately the pasta was overdone.......a cardinal sin in Italian cuisine. The homemade lasagna was very well done. The service was good and the ambiance and atmosphere was nice. We sat on the patio overlooking the mall. This is closer to 3.5 stars but I cannot forgive overdone pasta so it slips to 3 stars.

Exc - None
Good - Food
Ave - None
Poor - Overdone pasta.

WOULD I GO BACK? Probably not.

This place is good for an Italian restaurant in a mall (Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile).

They have a decent wine selection, a variety of Italian dishes, a brunch menu and best of all, they make their pasta noodles from scratch each morning for the day, and are cooked to order! :-)

Their desserts taste fresh and light regardless of how heavy/ rich they may seem. The tiramisu is light, fluffy and does not feel heavy or too condensed in texture. The cannolis shells are flaky, crisp and not too thick. Just right! The filling tastes like the ricotta is whipped with some sort of chocolate and has small chocolatechips as well. I rarely eat cannolis, but these were worth eating. They are actually better than the cannolis at my local Italian deli/ bakery, and that's saying something positive!

Our waiter was very sweet and attentive. They have an older man playing a violin on the patio area as well. 

If you're shopping in the Miracle Mile, I suggest eating here. I was pleased and would return.

Lasagna with beschamel sauce -  that is the only reason why I would go back there.  In fact, that wasn't even what I ordered, it was my boyfriend's dish.  I actually had some kind of breakfast/brunch item (it was quite forgetable compared to the lasagna).  

The lasagna noodles were cooked perfectly but seriously, the sauce, I can't stop thinking about the sauce - is so creamy, so flavorful and just so yummy.  The portion was also pretty generous.  A definite must-try!

We ordered off the the pre-show menu because these were included in our vouchers and the menu was slim. And is not vegetarian friendly. We had the tilapia dish which clearly looked to have been sitting on a hot plate for too long and tasted that way as well. Stale. The waitress also was not at all friendly or personable. This was a Sunday night 9/18 after 10p. The house salad is what earned this restaurant the 1 star instead of zero stars. :)

Reviews seem to range over an extreme for this restaurant but we had a very good experience on both food and service. Also, sitting outside the restaurant in the "faux" outdoor setting with the blue sky overhead provided a nice ambiance. The menu is pretty extensive so finding a good dish is easy.

The fettuccine Alfredo is my favorite here. The menu is fairly traditional Italian and you can sit inside or outside. Our server Miguel was so nice and he even brought me over free dessert for my birthday. What a nice touch! The tiramisu was excellent, so fluffy and moist. 
I would go back and try some other dessert. I also recommend making a reservation because we ended up having to wait for about 10 mins. It was too bad but we were hungry!

Stopped by for a quick lunch. Had fast service. The waiter wasn't moody when we got tap water and shared a meal, which was refreshing. They have "al fresco" dining which is kinda cheesy but good for people watching. The food was ok...not great enough for me to go back, but the service was great!
