Only reason we dined here was because we had two free dinners from Hilton Grand Vacations.  We both had the Rigatoni selection.  It was average at best as was the Caesar Salad.  The salad had no taste at all.  Charge $8.75 before tax for a bottle of IPA beer which is just crazy.

My review is gonna be a harsh one because I compare Italian food to, well Italy. Living in Italy for 2yrs I know the simplest of dishes can still be flavorful. 

Not impressed by anything our server, Doreen recommended. 

The best thing coming out of here is the kids spaghetti and meat ball. Good size portion too. 

Heads up!!!! They add 18% grat to your bill if your are a party of 5 or more. And our server was NOT worth $25 tip. She forgot our waters twice and seemed very rushed. 

Bottom line. Do not waist your time here. Food does not have flavor and the price is ridiculous for tasting bland.

My mom and I had dinner here recently before a show.  We were seated right away in their outdoor patio (not really outdoor since its inside a mall).  We had a great waitress.  She was attentive and friendly.  She came by frequently, as well as the bus person to fill water glasses and take away empty plates.

I had the Veal Scaloppine mushroom marsala wine sauce. served with seasonal vegetables & mashed potatoes.  The veal was very tender, could cut it with a fork.  The sauce was yummy.  Lots of mushrooms.  Sides were good too.  Mom had the pepperoni pizza.  Nice thin crust with spicy pepperoni.  I had a bite and it was very tasty.

If you happen to be at the Miracle Mile shops or Planet Hollywood, this is definitely a great dinner spot.  Good traditional Italian food.

Came back again, and again did not disappoint! The spaghetti and kids pizza were perfectly made and hit the spot! The creme brûlée... say hello to my heart! Thank you to the staff for your patience with my noisy crew and making sure our glasses were always full!

Oh yum yum yum!  Forgive me as I may have a hard time recalling my time here, because the server was so nice with the ongoing mimosas which I asked with a splash of cherry.  These buggers were so delicious to me and after your first initial mimosa, the second is a $1.  Our server was so kind and gave us a second glass for $1 instead of both us having to pay $7 each for our first glass.

The belgium waffle was so delish!  it's soo small with four half slices of waffles, I may be small but I eat my weight every time.  The other side of the plate is filled with whipped cream and a quarter of that half had a small selection of berries.  Regardless, the waffle was fluffy and heavenly paired with the whipped topping and fruit.  The bacon, you have to order the smoked bacon on the side because what is brunch without it? The server says it comes in three strips but we had more than three.  I was super happy because I needed the greasy goodness to counter the buzz I was getting from the mimosa.  Well it didn't counter it, I was just super happy because it was damn good.

Hubz ordered the hash dish with potatoes, brisket, and I think poached eggs on top.  Wasn't sure because we smashed it all together.  The only way you can eat it!  The brisket was tender but some were a bit hard but the yolk soften it up by not much..

The scenery is nice and it's a chill spot.  I will come back here for brunch if I was staying at PH again.
Honestly don't come here..not worth the money. Food wasn't good..it did come in 2 minutes which is a great indication nothing is fresh..

I was just recently in Vegas this past week and was looking to try something new. I visit the Strip a few times a year and am always in search of something I have yet to try. 

Located in the hotel Paris, the atmosphere and decor around were pleasant. With a impersonating blue sky overhead, the area gives you a slight feel of Vegas' version of the great city. However, that is where the pluses seem to stop.

Upon gazing over the menu, delicious descriptions of simple dishes give way to belief of something worth dinning on. This was not the case. The bread they brought out to us was bland and almost disgusting. It looked appealing, hence why I decided to try it. But to my surprise, it was way worse than I anticipated.

I decided to order the chicken parmagana as my main dish. The description was great, and the smells of fresh food filled the air to accompany my appetite. When the dish arrived at the table, I was greeted by a, what I assume, previously frozen chicken cutlet topped with what tasted like canned tomato sauce. The dish had "processed" or frozen written all over it. However, to pay respects to the staff and chef, I finished my meal without verbal complaint. 

It is safe to say that I will not be stopping by this place again.
Our food was fantastic! And our server, Monique was amazing!!! Her attention to detail, and excellent customer service was exemplary!!! Thanks for a great meal and a fun night....
Just ate at this restaurant and all 4 of us disliked our meals. Could not even finish my salad. Save your money and do not eat here. I'd give it less than 1 star if I could.
Great service. Food was ok. Price not too bad. But the Creme Brulee was off the heezy! (;

Overpriced low quality food. Manager came around, asked us how we enjoyed our meal. When we told him the halibut was not good and the ravioli was had nothing inside he shrugged his shoulders and left. 

Service was also bad. Had to ask twice to order drinks and for bread to go with the oil they put on the table.  $100 bill and we left hungry!

Would not go back!

After one of my good high school friends told me about how amazing this place was, I was really excited to try it for their endless bellini/mimosa brunch.  

I'm very sad to say that I don't know what she was thinking!  I guess the hype factor could have made me dislike this place, but they messed up on a very simple omelette order (cheese, mushroom, spinach!), their bellini's and mimosas were just "eh", and I thought the potatoes that came with my omelette were just okay as well.  I've made better mimosas out of a $2 carton of OJ and cheap 1-year old champagne.  The one thing the whole table could agree on was that the bread and olive oil dip were delicious, but we're carb whores.

I wanna try this place for lunch/dinner some time, but I'm thinking that it'll just make me hate it more!
We stumbled on this place for lunch and was really impressed with the homemade pasta and cioppino!  Really excellent, and a great value.  A little gem in Vegas.

Our food wasn't good. Very expensive. 1 slice of lasagna was 19 bucks and some noodles and 5 shrimp was $23. Our waitress was terrible! We never got our water refilled. The waitress never came back to give us the check. We sat there for 15 minutes after asking for the check. Other waiters were just staring at us while she walked everywhere cut bread and didn't come back. We finally stood up and had to walk over to the back where the screens were and waited for her. She never once apologized or anything. She just came back and apparently are check was ready, she just left it on the counter...I signed it and she didn't even say thanks for coming or anything or have a nice night, just walked away.. for 2 people to eat with waters cost us $50...food and service weren't good. Would not come back here.

Our waiter, Sullivan, was really cool and helpful. They give you a big pizza-looking Focaccia bread - it's not too exciting though. We got the Paglia e fieno which was a favorite of Sullivan's...we thought it was just okay. It was $15, a little spendy for pasta.

Right next door to a RAGING sports bar and in front of the "dancing fountain" of the Shops at the Miracle Mile I found Lombardi's.  In  Wisconsin THE restaurant for fans of the Green Bay Packers has the same name.  However, rather than Midwestern friendliness, the General Manager was insulting and deceitful.  I have never had anybody give me the "talk to the hand" gesture until this boy - and he followed up by telling us the risotto was vegetarian.  I asked the waiter the same question and he emphatically stated "Chicken Stock."  The waiter was a really nice guy and saved our meal.  I had the ciopino over tagellini and my vegetarian spouse had the gnocci with vodka creme.  Both were tasty and worthy of a repeat.  My advice, don't sit outside in the mall (you can't hear a thing) and don't let the manager get away with any misinformation if you have dietary restrictions.

By far, the best Italian restaurant on the strip! The ambiance is amazing! The food is absolutely delectable, and the service is top notch (Thank you, Antonio)!  We ordered the vegetarian pizza and risotto con pollo. We also ordered a bottle of Italian wine, and finished off our meal with the best tiramisu I've ever had! We loved it so much, we're planning on going back tonight! If you come to Vegas, and craving excellent Italian, head over to Lombardi's! You won't be disappointed!

A terrible establishment and the gm of the restaurant misrepresents and point blank lies to customers. I came here for lunch, but the gm of the restaurant said they weren't serving lunch, but I could pay for their all you can eat/drink super bowl party. My buddy and I were starving and figured we might as well do it so we paid the $150 each. We pick our spot, set our stuff down, and head straight for the buffet. We were shocked to find out that the buffet is only a halftime food buffet and we were told if we were hungry now we could pay and order appetizers after already paying 150. When I immediately asked for a refund I was denied and was told it was impossible, but I could get a menu and pay to eat some appetizers or they were opening hot dog stand where I could pay $3 per hot dog in the mean time. As this clearly didn't resolve my issue I did not take a seat but stayed standing. I hadn't eaten yet today and it no longer was about the money, but the principle of the restaurant misrepresenting their business and taking advantage of my buddy and myself. If we were told the buffet didn't start til half time there was no way either of us would've stopped or considered paying for their super bowl party. A nice staff/waitress came over and said she'd talk to the manager. The manager let me know "there was nothing she could do" which I knew was complete bullsh*t. I was then informed that the guy who lied to my buddy and me was the gm and he was the only one who could do anything. He finally offered to give us one "free" appetizer and popcorn after my buddy and I paid $300 total. At this point I just wanted my money back and find another place to eat. The gm finally realized that I was not going to sit down. He finally offered a $200 refund from my $300 payment. To make a long story short my buddy and I paid $100 to waste 30min of our super bowl Sunday because the gm point blank lied to us and charged us $100 when no service was provided.

Calamari was great as was veggie pizza

I refused to go back to Cabo Wabo which was one of the worst meals I've ever had and terribly expensive.  So I was wary of Lombardi's even though it was recommended at Planet Hollywood.

It seem there are fewer and fewer choices in the Desert Passage / Miracle Mile mall.  I've seen places like Hawaiian Tropic and Trader Vic's come and go.  So Lombardi's would stand out even if it were not for it's quality food and great service. 

If you're super hungry the bread and olive oil is a great way to start your meal as are the appetizers.  

The pasta is very good as is the veggie pizza. Our server recommended the calamari and it was very good.

 Even though I love Italian food I don't love all Italian food necessarily.  But Lombardi's does a good job of providing the usual dishes in a fresh way.

If I could do less than one star that's what this place would get. The food was awful. I had the chicken Marsala and the marsala sauce was not very flavorful. The vegetables that came with it was mushy and bland. The side of fettuccine was horrible. My fiancé ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and she took two bites and was done. It was horrible. Never again.

Stopped in here for dinner last night.  Not so good right from the beginning.  We approached the check in desk (no we did not have reservations - we live in Vegas and just happened to be down on Las Vegas Blvd for another reason)  The manager asked us how many, we said two, as he was going to seat us 3 people walked up and said that they thought there friend was already inside and that they had reservations.  He just walked away from us, not a word and took the 3 people to their seat.  Maybe a, I will be right back could of been said?  When he returned he passed the menu's to a young female who took us to our table. We were seated outside where it was super noisy and too be expected when seated in this area.  The restaurant inside was approximately 90% empty.  When we were finally approached by our waiter we asked if we could perhaps be seated in side.  He said yes and then just stood there and looked at us.  I finally asked if he coul check for sure and have someone move us if possible.  The young female returned and took us inside.  It was a little better.  Now we sit for approximately 7 minutes with no service from anyone - no water, no bread no nothing.  Finally the waitress leans over and said she would be with us in a few minutes.  Probably 5 minutes later she returned.  We ordered our wine and when that arrived we ordered our dinner.  Both my dinner and my husbands dinner were mudh less then average.  My husband ordered Pollo Parmigiana.  The chicken was extrely dry and tasteless.  I ordered Risotto Capesante.  The risotto was bland and the scallops were extremely fishie.  Yes I know that scallops are from the sea but I also know that when fish in a restaurant is that strong it ususally means it is close to beging bad.  
We ordered coffee and even that wasn't good.  Our meal came to around $100 - not much for a strip meal but so not worth the money.  We probably should of just gone and grabbed a burger.  I'm sure it would have tasked better. 
Won't be there again.

The food seemed fairly basic to me. We had a free food voucher and we wanted to tip on what the total would have been, but we had to guess since the bill only stated the balance for our drinks and extras. The flatbread and Caesar salad were just okay for me. The best dish was the Tilapia in a roasted pepper sauce. It was truly delicious. Our server was friendly and attentive and they sat us in a really comfortable booth in the back.

Really Amazing meat lasagna. We ordered to go and the portion size is about that of a TV dinner smart ones meal FYI. The bread was warm but A little hard to chew, but that's just the type. The staff and manager was very friendly and service was fast. All in all very nice place in planet Hollywood.

Really 3.5 but didn't want to round up.

Food 4.5. Good Italian. Heavy sauces but done well.  Lobster ravioli 25 used.Small portion but good flavor so.  Pappardelle ? Not sure how to spell.  Suggested by waitress. Really good. Sauce was heavy and creamy but still was well done. 20 used. Kids meatball and spaghetti 7 used.   Average marinara sauce but my daughter liked it.  I liked the meatballs.

Service 3. Not rude like say Chinese restraunts rude but not helpful. Food came out ninja fast.  For us with two kids was good. Wait staff seemed to be every man for himself. Asked 3 times for water so finally got it from manager.  Others experiences seem to have good service. Maybe just an off night. also mistakenly overcharged me for a kids drink which was an annoyance.

Ambiance 4. Forgot I was in a mall for a second.  Doesn't feel like Italy but then a lot closer. 

All in all I may come back for the food.  At my age and with so many good restraunts where we live, I typically will not frequent a restraunts with poor service.  If u happen to be at miracle mile, seems to me to be the best choice and I would give it a try. Not cheap but not expensive.

Went here with my bachelorette party. They had our table ready and the food was delicious. The waitress was rude tho and snotty. My cousin asked if they had bread and she said yes but they bring it out with dinner, she asked if she could just bring it out before dinner and the waitress was looking at her like uhhhhh no! What's the difference? She also didn't provide the table with water, you had to ask if you wanted some I thought it was normal to just provide water anyway. The gnocchi caprese was awesome.

I was on a family trip in Vegas and my brother was craving some Italian food (like always). To cut the story short.. after some Fat Tuesday's we stumbled onto this place that looked interesting. It is located in the Miracle Mile shops (part of Planet Hollywood). Normally you don't expect to find really good food in a shopping center (or equivalent), but it really is one of my favorite places. I have brought friends here over and over every time I go. Every time my friends loved it. Not to mention that I watched my winning parlay ticket here.. so bonus points. ;-) But back on a serious note.. it really is a great place.. great eggplant parmigiana, same with their chicken parmigiana, and delicious gnocchi.  They also have what I believe is foccacia bread (or something super thin) that comes with cheese (Parmesan sprinkled on top) and oil and vinegar (on the side).. this used to be complimentary, but I think they charge for it now. Anyhow, highly recommended. Must try at least once!!

Let's face it, if you're in the shops by Planet Hollywood, food choices are a bit limited.  In need of drinks and a little something to eat, we landed here on a Sunday afternoon.  Pretty much had the place to ourselves.  We chose the bar as we didn't want a full meal.

Husband enjoyed his Manhattan and I had a nice Chianti.  We shared a perfectly delicious sausage and peppers pizza.  Highlight was the awesome complimentary bread and beautiful trio of nice olive oil, parmesan and balsamic to dip into.  Yum!  

Atmosphere is a bit dated, but the food, service and drinks were just what we needed!

Good Italian food. Moderate prices for a place in the middle of the strip. The service was great and quick. It is located within the Miracle Mile shopping center linked to The Planet Hollywood casino. Nicely themed restaurant. Seating available within the restaurant and along the mall's walkways near a large fountain. We had the meal that was packed with tickets to the Saxe Theater. The meal always has a $20 value whatever your hear . We enjoyed ourselves and will come back.

Located in Planet Hollywood.

My family was walking around PH looking for a place to eat a casual dinner. Lombardi's hit the spot! We got seated without a wait, and got the "patio" area so got to people watch as well.

Our server was fantastic. Super helpful and nice. He recommended some tasty dishes as well! It was with his recommendation that I tried the Manhattan clam chowder for the first time.

The Manhattan clam chowder was SO good. Given that I have no prior experience, this was still super tasty. For my entree, I got the lasagna. The sauce was flavorful. Unfortunately, the noodle, cheese, and meat ratio was off. Not enough cheese and meat.

Came here with a dinner credit so menu options were very limited. (They actually give you a separate menu when you're dining with a credit.) I got the chicken Marsala which was very good, but also something I make at home fairly regularly so it wasn't anything to write home about. My husband and I shared a Nutella panna cotta for dessert and it was PHENOMENAL. I'm going to make an attempt to make it myself this weekend. 

It was definitely really good, but next time I'll order off the regular menu for something a little more adventurous.
